commit 4bc50f4366c9f5350c6a794ea35d22837dce50f2
Author: Dmitriy Tverdiakov <11927660+injectives@users.noreply.github.com>
Date:   Thu Apr 29 15:44:33 2021 +0100

    Added authorization expired response handling (#886)
    
    * Added authorization expired response handling
    
    This update adds support for authorization expired response handling. When such error arrives the driver will mark all connections that were created on or before the creation timestamp of the receiving connection for disposal. The connections will be allowed to finish what they are doing and released back to the pool and will be disposed on the next acquire call.
    
    This update also makes sure that we always register the HELLO response handler so that we can handle the response appropriately.
    
    In addition, it adds the ROLLBACK message support to the driver backend.
    
    * Fixed HELLO verification in tests
    
    * Fixed BEGIN message handling in stub server scripts
    
    * Fixed locks in reactive tests
    
    * Added connection hangups
    
    * Reverted logging change

commit b2237b8d38c1cbc37ea69addf5bbb31e9f1df496
Author: gjmwoods <42248895+gjmwoods@users.noreply.github.com>
Date:   Wed Mar 31 16:58:07 2021 +0100

    Include bookmarks in the ROUTE message. (#861)
    
    Adding bookmarks to ROUTE message
    
    The new format is: `ROUTE {routingContext} [listOfBookmarks] dbname`
     where (in order of occurrence):
    - `routingContext` provided by the driver.
    - A list of bookmarks. If none are provided then an empty list should be supplied.
    - the `dbname` of the database for which a new routing table is being requested. This is a string value and can be replaced with `null` to return the default database's routing table.

commit b98b6974e1203844eb193a34ec7a68cefb21f130
Author: Dmitriy Tverdiakov <11927660+injectives@users.noreply.github.com>
Date:   Wed Mar 17 14:20:20 2021 +0000

    Fix for initial routers DNS resolution (#849)
    
    * Fix for initial routers DNS resolution
    
    This update fixes the following issue: https://github.com/neo4j/neo4j-java-driver/issues/833
    
    The desired behaviour for getting a routing table from the initial router (either on bootstrap or when all known routers have failed) is:
    - resolve the domain name to all IPs
    - attempt getting a routing table from all of them until first one succeeds by:
      - getting a connection
      - trying to get a successful routing table response
    
    Prior to this change, the connection pools were created for host and port pairs. When domain name of the host resolves to multiple IP addresses, such pools provide connections to those IPs as a group. While this works for readers and writers, it negatively impacts the routing table fetching process as there is no guarantee which IP address the provided connection is setup for.
    
    This update delivers the following changes:
    - connection pools for routers are IP address based, which allows for deterministic connection retrieval
    - the resolved IP address set is kept up-to-date (in case known router IPs change) to make sure that the unused connection pools are flushed
    - the domain name resolution logic has been made configurable (it is private at the moment and is used to facilitate testing)
    - the testkit backend has been updated to support the domain name resolution configuration (a new test has been added to testkit to cover the issue described above)
    - the testkit backend has been updated to support connection timeout driver configuration
    - several tests have been updated to adopt the new changes
    
    * Updating test name

commit 61767e8dc3747ea9217b579052fd5d556609b8cb
Author: Michael Simons <michael.simons@neo4j.com>
Date:   Wed Feb 17 13:47:28 2021 +0100

    Avoid 3rd party imports for Java Doc. (#823)
    
    One of our 3rd party dependencies, `org.reactivestreams.Subscription`, was imported just for a JavaDoc. This lead to a situation where the usage of the `Config` class needs the library on the classpath. We can avoid this by using a fully qualified import in the Javadoc.
    
    I fixed the other 6 imports for consistency, even though they are from our own code.

driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/Config.java

    DNS change fix
    
    This update fixes an issue when the driver fails to update the routing table if the router DNS entry returns a different IP address.

commit c987d9af1bba054ff0e476868a3b6b09cbbcdf5f
Author: Antonio Barc√©los <antonio.barcelos@neo4j.com>
Date:   Wed Dec 9 12:11:13 2020 +0100

    Add support to 4.2 by implementing the extended handshake
    
    The Bolt handshake is a short exchange that occurs after the opening of every Bolt connection. It is used to establish a protocol version for subsequent messaging activity. The sequence is currently limited to four fixed protocol versions; these changes implement a mechanism to extend that to protocol version ranges.
    
    In Bolt v1, the four bytes were treated as a single big-endian unsigned 32-bit integer, with the protocol versioned only via a single number. In Bolt 4.0, the scheme evolved such that bytes D and C represented the major and minor version numbers respectively; bytes A and B were ignored, reserved for future use.
    
    The scheme is to be extended such that byte B can be used to allow the sequence to encode an inclusive range of versions in the client-to-server request. The server-to-client response would remain the same, specifying only a single version.
    
    Specifically, the range minimum and maximum can be computed as follows:
    
    Range maximum = D.C
    Range minimum = D.(C - B)
    
    This denotes byte B as a minor version difference, backwards from the minor version in byte C. In other words, zero denotes "zero versions back", one denotes "one version back", and so on. Note that this specifically requires the range to exist within the same major version, but does provide backwards compatibility with existing implementations, which fill bytes A and B with zeroes.
    
    Note also that a range with an identical min and max should be considered semantically equivalent to a single version.

driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/async/connection/BoltProtocolUtil.java
driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/messaging/BoltProtocolVersion.java
driver/src/test/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/async/connection/BoltProtocolUtilTest.java
driver/src/test/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/messaging/BoltProtocolVersionTest.java

commit bb4cd2b77bc82fda572120003692e1bf2a50c2a7
Author: Antonio Barcelos <antonio.barcelos@neo4j.com>
Date:   Wed Oct 14 16:22:45 2020 +0200

    Creating protocol 4.3 and uses the Route Message to get the routing table
    
    The objective of the commit/pr is create the infracture needed to support
    the version 4.3 of bolt protocol, including the handshake and the serialization
    and use of the ROUTE message to get the routing table.
    
    In manner to support the version 4.3 of the protocol, the handshake was adjusted and the version 4.0 was removed from it.
    
    Some adjustments was done into the RoutingProcedureRunner which now instead of be a base class with the implementation of the single database routing procedure runner,  it's the interface used by the runners.

commit 4dabf241b3df55c1749fb0414b1fcd5274f3cd7b
Author: Gregory Woods <gregory.woods@neo4j.com>
Date:   Fri Oct 23 14:09:27 2020 +0100

    Refactor Testkit-backend to use jackson for databinding
    
    The objective of this commit is to support the current enabled tests on the Java Testkit Suite in more extensible and maintainable structure.
    
    The commands were separated in different objects which are mapped by Jackson and ran by the CommandProcessor. Jackson is also responsible for serializing the response using custom serializers to map values and records to CypherValues, structure used by teskit to return the values with the type information.

commit 16bdde313b0a4099e11aeb0a86e60f1deceac739
Author: gjmwoods <42248895+gjmwoods@users.noreply.github.com>
Date:   Wed Sep 30 13:46:56 2020 +0100

    OCSP Stapling Checks (#756)
    
    Adds the ability for TrustStategy to configure whether or not certificate revocation checking is to be carried out. By default revocation checking is disabled.
    
    If enabled the driver will check the validity of stapled OCSP (Online Certificate Status Protocol) response(s). These responses are returned during the TLS handshake by the server and if not present, the driver will fail to accept the certificate.
    
    See: https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6961

    4.2 TestKit Backend (#761)
    
    This change introduces a testing component that allows for tests to be written once in a central repo (https://github.com/neo4j-drivers/testkit) and then executed for each driver.
    
    The build produces an executable server that acts as the intermediatory with TestKit.

commit 9ed7d75e15f5fea46284911735095034bc0eedbb
Author: Michael Simons <michael.simons@neo4j.com>
Date:   Fri Jun 26 09:47:42 2020 +0200

    GH-742 - Fix native compilation with Netty 4.1.50 on GraalVM.
    
    Netty 4.1.50 needs two fixes for in our setup for native compilation on GraalVM:
    
    * Remove substitutions for io.netty.handler.ssl.Java9SslEngine. as `io.netty.handler.ssl.Java9SslEngine` has been removed in Netty 4.1.50, Graal cannot substitute a class not on the classpath.
    
    * Remove the substitution for the task queue in the `io.netty.channel.nio.NioEventLoop` class. Thus, the JCTools Mpsc will be used instead.
    
    The Mpsc queues need a bit of reflection to work in native mode, but this is very isolated. Also, Netty upgraded to JCTools 3.0.0 in 4.1.46 and the Mpsc queues now are triggered during class initialition already, even with the substitution.
    So we should live with the bits of reflection in native mode and remove the somewhat brittle substitution along the way.
    
    Also it seems that the system property `io.netty.noUnsafe` which we set in the `native-image.properties` is not taken into account at all.

driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/svm/NettySubstitutions.java
driver/src/main/resources/META-INF/native-image/org.neo4j.driver/neo4j-java-driver/reflection-config.json

Date:   Thu Jun 11 10:28:26 2020 +0200

    Improve channel tracking. (#740)
    
    This uses a reentrant read/write lock to avoid synchronizing and a mixture of concurrent hashmaps and atomic integers.

commit 233e0e4c4dda7f1d2cc8289756497b1d841514cd
Author: gjmwoods <42248895+gjmwoods@users.noreply.github.com>
Date:   Wed Jun 10 19:11:48 2020 +0100

    Don‚Äôt swallow the cause of a TX termination. (#731) (#737)
    
    * Don‚Äôt swallow the cause of a TX termination.
    
    There are a couple of scenarions in which a transaction gets terminated. The cause will be propagated by the pull handler and the transaction will be marked accordingly. There might be a chance that a degration from a leader to a follower on the server side happens in between to calls to a run method on that transaction: The transaction is still open, but cannot run queries any longer. Outside a transactional function this leads correctly to a ClientException. Inside a transactional function, this must not happen.
    
    The retry logic must be able to find the cause of the termination and if there‚Äôs any, it should judge on the cause if it retries or not.
    
    This PR changes the following:
    
    - Add a StateHolder to the UnmangedTransaction
    - The holder is necessary to keep the single field volatie
    - The holder holds the state and a possible cause of termination
    - The holder is able to determine whether a session is still open or not.
    - It removes markTerminated from InternalAsyncTransaction as it was used only for tests.
    
    * Polishing.
    
    This removes the circular dependency between holder and state. I had introduced it cause I wanted to avoid object allocation. This solution here is better: It also creates only 3 different holders for non terminated states, but without the circular dependency.
    
    Co-authored-by: Gregory Woods <gregory.woods@neo4j.com>
    
    Co-authored-by: Michael Simons <michael.simons@neo4j.com>

commit c9ff8e7d02472c310eaaeb2f13ef233dcefef1cd
Author: gurkerl83 <gurkerl83@googlemail.com>
Date:   Thu Jun 4 12:56:45 2020 +0200

    Do not expect package com.oracle.svm at OSGi runtime (#699)
    
    In the current build process, some SVM substitutions got integrated to generate a native-image of the library. From an OSGi perspective, the integration of Oracles, respectively, Graal's substrate dependency causes an unintentional statement in the manifest.mf of the build result expecting a package called com.oracle.svm.
    
    This pull request adjusts the osgi.bnd file to avoid the com.oracle.svm package from being required when the bundle gets executed in an OSGi runtime.
    
    Expose also drivers internal package
    
    Libraries such as neo4j-ogm and its modules neo4j-ogm-bolt-driver and neo4j-ogm-bolt-native-types require access to the internal package of the neo4j java driver. To hide the internal package from the outside world classes used in neo4j-ogm such as InternalBookmark, Scheme has to be relocated to different package in further refactoring. For now, in OSGi work with neo4j-ogm and the bolt driver, especially the entire internal module, has to be exposed.
    
    Co-authored-by: gurkerl83 <markus_gritsch@gmx.de>

driver/osgi.bnd

commit 31d3495a16aaf02a78d1ebfc70b0a73f0f554f46
Author: gjmwoods <42248895+gjmwoods@users.noreply.github.com>
Date:   Thu May 28 08:06:29 2020 +0100

    Since Server v4.0 the server agent received in response to the Hello message is unreliable. Instead, since the server and Bolt protocol versions are aligned, we use the protocol version instead for all connections to Server 4.0 and higher (#708) (#718)
    
    Note: A future refactoring is required when support for 3.5 is dropped. The name serverVersion filed of the netty channel no longer reflects its true purpose since it essentially becomes protocolVersion. We keep the current naming for now since the split in meaning between 3.5 and 4.X+

commit d7c1c1c87d9bba5ceaa9c7a6bcfe9206f225bb41
Author: gjmwoods <42248895+gjmwoods@users.noreply.github.com>
Date:   Wed May 27 13:33:42 2020 +0100

    Fix JavaDoc on JDK 11. (#702) (#713)
    
    - JDK 11 JavaDoc is less lenient with HTML tags inside a <code>-block, so this needed a fix.
    - We don‚Äôt use java-modules, so all modules are undefined. Therefor the search is broken.
    
    There are 2 solutions to the later:
    1. Disabling modules in java-doc with `--no-module-directories`, but that also applies to references to JDK classes, which would than be broken.
    
    2. (The one applied here): Check if `useModuleDirectories` is set to something different than literal `undefined`: If so, leave it and let JavaDocs JavaScript magic handle things, otherwise set it to false, causing JavaDocs JavaScript todo nothing. For reference: https://stackoverflow.com/a/57284322/1547989
    
    Co-authored-by: Michael Simons <michael.simons@neo4j.com>

driver/pom.xml
driver/src/main/javadoc/overview.html

    Improve Record#get(String key) complexity to O(1)

commit db8a804cd9fc6a65e1657b951a581514aaed81e4
Author: Zhen Li <zhen.li@neotechnology.com>
Date:   Thu Apr 9 16:56:12 2020 +0200

    Fixes red tests

driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/InternalRecord.java
driver/src/test/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/handlers/RunResponseHandlerTest.java

commit b14967219419feebe721a18425d11b9b3db71061
Author: Zhen Li <zhen.li@neotechnology.com>
Date:   Thu Apr 9 15:07:13 2020 +0200

    Improve Record#get(String key) complexity to O(1)
    
    The previous impl gives O(n) complexity because of index lookup in keys list. As the API of two Record#get methods are so similar, it is a valid assumption that the performance of two methods shall be the same.
    This PR introduces a lookup map to use one extra small space to improve `Record#get(String key)` complexity from O(n) to O(1).

driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/InternalRecord.java

commit da9c7518dea2f73afacd7f84c181a9d22f3d3d0c
Author: Zhen Li <zhen.li@neotechnology.com>
Date:   Thu Nov 28 19:29:40 2019 +0100

    Adding multidb feature detection `Driver#supportsMultiDb`
    For a single driver, we will open a connection with the init server and then check if the server version is 4.0+ and talking with driver using bolt v4.
    For a routing driver, we will go through all addresses that are resolved from the init seed server. Then we will check with the first successfully connected server if the server version is 4.0+ and talking with driver using protocol bolt v4.

commit 32e3b66de030ace24252103069f7dd2013c6dc37
Author: Zhen Li <zhen.li@neotechnology.com>
Date:   Mon Oct 21 23:01:10 2019 +0200

    Throw helpful error message when nesting transactions inside one session.
    Session only support one active transaction (either auto-commit or exmplicit transaction) at a given time.
    
    For async and blocking sessions, when we chaining a new transaction while there is an on-going auto-commit transaction, we can allow users to "nesting transactions" in one session by sending a pull all for the preceding auto-commit transaction.
    However we cannot do the same for reactive sessions as project reactive will error if the underlying publisher does not respect back pressure.
    
    Ensure helpful error message when accessing results after the statement runner where the results belongs to is closed.

commit 9014d06d7bf864238ba70cfe58b65c8435c6b926
Author: Zhen Li <zhen.li@neotechnology.com>
Date:   Fri Oct 11 12:26:55 2019 +0200

    Fixed a bug found with ClusterStressIT regarding how we send run and pull messages.
    
    When creating the async result, we write a RUN message, followed by a PULL message.
    The RUN and PULL messages shall be flushed together.
    
    If RUN and PULL are flushed separately, the following scenario may happen:
    
    C: RUN "RETURN Wrong" {} {mode="r"}
    S: FAILURE Neo.ClientError.Statement.SyntaxError "Variable `Wrong` not defined (line 1, column 8 (offset: 7))
    C: RESET
    C: PULL {n=1000}
    S: SUCCESS {}
    S: FAILURE Neo.ClientError.Request.Invalid "Message 'PULL Map{n -> Long(1000)}' cannot be handled by a session in the READY state."

commit 60c57d18ce9cbb9c0ab57ccc2dd5686e25fbc477
Author: Michael Simons <michael.simons@neo4j.com>
Date:   Fri Sep 27 17:34:14 2019 +0200

    Upgrade to Project Reactor 3.3.0.RELEASE.
    
    The 3.3.x series will be the foundation for the Spring Data version we are targeting and I would prefer those dependencies to be somewhat aligned, to avoid issues and clashes early on.
    
    The API didn‚Äôt change, waiting for the test to go green.

pom.xml

commit b03bc8948258fe15ae7695cf6241aef412489fcd
Author: Michael Simons <michael.simons@neo4j.com>
Date:   Fri Sep 27 17:28:39 2019 +0200

    Add support for native compilation.
    
    This commit adds the following:
    
    - Oracle SVM, part of the Graal VM that allows substitutes for classes and methods, deleting them and aliasing them on the GraalVM.
    - Substitutions to make Netty work natively with SSL. Those substitutions live under internal/svm and are not visible when used outside GraalVM
    
    The PR also removes Nettys own native-image properties and replaces them with the setting needed for our driver.
    
    Those settings cannot be easily rewritten using the Shade transformer, so it‚Äôs more simple to do it by hand.
    
    The changes have been tested sucessfully on Graal 19.2.0.1 with Quarkus and Helidon microservices framework compiled natively.

driver/pom.xml
driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/svm/NettySubstitutions.java
driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/svm/ZLibSubstitutions.java
driver/src/main/resources/META-INF/native-image/org.neo4j/driver/native-image.properties
driver/src/main/resources/META-INF/native-image/org.neo4j/driver/reflection-config.json
pom.xml

commit 26aff781f498631eb35b58962655c3da49feecaf
Author: Zhen Li <zhen.li@neotechnology.com>
Date:   Fri Sep 27 16:01:21 2019 +0200

    Better error message for default database routing table update
    
    Introduced `DatabaseName` which provides a `description` method to better describe the database name.
    This avoid checking if database string is for "default database" everywhere in our code. It also simplifies internal logic to distinguish between database name not provided or default database name is provided.

commit decba71e840f1215329374d46121deee63b797e7
Author: Zhen Li <zhen.li@neotechnology.com>
Date:   Wed Sep 25 15:12:59 2019 +0200

    Deadlock Issues Caused by Netty Blocking `ChannelPool#close`.
    
    The new netty version provides both blocking pool close `FixedChannelPool#close` and async pool close `FixedChannelPool#closeAsync`.
    The blocking close causes deadlock issues in our code.
    
    One deadlock issue happens when `ConnectionPoolImpl#retainAll` trying to close a netty pool inside an IO thread that is used by one of the channels owned by the closing pool.
    
    The deadlock happens because
    1) The channel cannot be closed until the IO thread is fully free.
    2) The pool cannot be closed until the channel is closed.
    3) However the IO thread cannot be free until the pool is closed.
    `pool --wait-on--> channel --wait-on--> IO thread --wait-on--> pool`
    
    The fix is to change 3) to let the IO thread to call async pool close to not block the close operation.
    
    Another deadlock issue happens in `Driver#close`.
    
    In `Driver#close`, we need to chain the event loop group shutdown after all pool close.
    As pool close tasks are executed on event loop group, if we shutdown event loop group first,
    then the pool close will be stuck because of no thread to pick up any shutdown tasks.

driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/async/pool/ConnectionPoolImpl.java
driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/async/pool/ExtendedChannelPool.java
driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/async/pool/NettyChannelPool.java
driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/util/Futures.java
driver/src/test/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/async/pool/ConnectionPoolImplIT.java
driver/src/test/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/async/pool/ConnectionPoolImplTest.java

commit 5418cb7fd4f76f4c8827095fe944db1d76d9e02d
Author: Zhen Li <zhen.li@neotechnology.com>
Date:   Tue Sep 24 18:31:33 2019 +0200

    Update netty version to the latest.
    In the updated netty pool,
    `ChannelPoolHandler#channelCreated` is called at channel creation, and then `ChannelPoolHandler#channelAcquired` is called when the connection is borrowed out of the pool. When acquiring a connection from a newly created pool, a new connection will be created and then acquired. In previous netty version, when a connection is created, then it is directly lent out of the pool without being acquired. Thus we need to change some logic regarding how to count in use and idle connections.

driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/async/pool/NettyChannelTracker.java
driver/src/test/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/async/pool/ConnectionPoolImplIT.java
driver/src/test/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/async/pool/NettyChannelTrackerTest.java
driver/src/test/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/cluster/loadbalancing/RoutingTableAndConnectionPoolTest.java
pom.xml

commit 4856b721d0c93c1162da70d6ab5a9eced924bdf6
Author: Zhen Li <zhen.li@neotechnology.com>
Date:   Tue Sep 24 15:28:54 2019 +0200

    Fix after cypher validate WGS-84 input Y coordinates.
    Server side cypher chagnes: WGS-84 points will now properly validate their input coordinates. Values for latitude should always lie in the interval [-90, 90], any other value outside this range will throw an exception. Values for longitude should always lie in the interval [-180, 180], any other value outside this range will now be wrapped around to fit in this range.

driver/src/test/java/org/neo4j/driver/integration/SpatialTypesIT.java

    Reactive shall discard records on commit and/or rollback.
    If summary has not yet arrived, tx.commit/rollback -> DISCARD n=-1, COMMIT/ROLL_BACK

commit 83d57d7fcd94baa5c4e0e2d852c6eef2dbf0f9ff
Author: Zhen Li <zhen.li@neotechnology.com>
Date:   Thu Aug 22 17:02:18 2019 +0200

    Removed `Transaction#success` and `Transaction#failure`
    
    Changed the behaviour of `AsyncTransaction#commitAsync` and `AsyncTransaction#rollbackAsync` to throw error when committing/rolling back second time.
    A transaction can be allowed to commit or rollback once, but closed multiple times.
    This bring the behaviour of commit and rollback the same as 4.0 core API, as well as all other language drivers.

    Default to always perform client host name verification when encryption is on.
    
    Deleted some code used to support server version earlier than 3.3.0.

commit 08c85612f8229a1fa8dc60a78023eb7f0c8e0e1b
Author: Zhen Li <zhen.li@neotechnology.com>
Date:   Mon Jul 22 17:08:15 2019 +0200

    Avoid a queue for shaded record publisher
    By default, when creating a publisher via `Flux.create` a `BufferAsyncSink` will be used and a queue is created to buffer all data the client cannot process in time.
    With reactor being shaded, the reactor users cannot benifit from this queue and will have to create this queue again when creating from driver's record publisher.
    Thus we configure the driver to create a publisher without any active buffering. The application will be fully in charge of buffer consumed data instead.

driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/reactive/InternalRxStatementResult.java

Author: Zhen Li <zhen.li@neotechnology.com>
Date:   Mon Jul 22 16:56:50 2019 +0200

    Normalize database name to lowercase on client to avoid creating multiple routing tables for the same database

commit d03e9f2263be8a8d05e73f4ced5bc004ef1252e6
Author: Zhen Li <zhen.li@neotechnology.com>
Date:   Thu Jul 4 17:38:12 2019 +0200

    Re-enabling all muted tests.
    
    The tests were failing because in 4.0 we introduced a new parallel runtime which does not preserve the order of the unwind lists.
    As the driver tests are testing the driver not missing any records rather than cypher semantics, we change the query to preserve order in our test instead.

commit 6fd23843348f908e2aca5349a41ed6d9d5212fa5
Author: Zhen Li <zhen.li@neotechnology.com>
Date:   Mon Apr 15 17:48:58 2019 +0200

    For routing driver, by default, get the routing table for default-database.
    As this makes the routing table map easier for server version lower than 4.0.
    Otherwise, if we default to get routing table for system_db, we need to detect if it is server version lower than 4.0. If so, we can only get routing table for default_db, and then we need to reset the key in routing table map to be default_db.
    
    TODO: Removing stale routing table from routing table map.
    Also missing any integration tests for 4.0 routing driver.

commit e33b8b1ebf5e7ca39fec6b9250eb9868e803cbf0
Author: Zhen Li <zhen.li@neotechnology.com>
Date:   Mon May 6 21:44:35 2019 +0200

    Suppress `pool was closed` errors
    In a routing driver, it is possible that a thread will try to acquire a connection from a pool which might have been closed by another thread.
    This happens when thread A obtains a server S to establish a connection. While thread B triggers updating routing table and removes server S from the routing table and connection pool. Then when thread A process to acquire a connection with server S, then we will end up with this pool was closed error.
    This race condition cannot be avoided due to the nature of multi-threading. However when it happens, we can catch the error and treat it as a normal IO Error.

driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/async/pool/ConnectionPoolImpl.java
driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/async/pool/ExtendedChannelPool.java
driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/async/pool/NettyChannelPool.java
driver/src/test/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/async/pool/ConnectionPoolImplIT.java
driver/src/test/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/async/pool/ConnectionPoolImplTest.java

commit a3b1fdfdde1f134bfd344d867bbb70457b82d2b4
Author: Darko Radosavljevic <darkorcar@gmail.com>
Date:   Tue Apr 30 17:23:13 2019 +0100

    Fix idleTooLong trace massage

driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/async/pool/NettyChannelHealthChecker.java

commit 80203b3f19cd3a4535ac6cd907218164df5c7ed1
Author: Zhen Li <zhen.li@neotechnology.com>
Date:   Mon May 6 15:06:26 2019 +0200

    Unified the input and output value of database name.
    
    The database name default to `null` if the server does not support multi-databases when the database name is returned in result summary.
    However `null` is a forbidden value for database in session parameters. Then for user who want to connect to default db but do not want ot omit invoke `withDatabase` method on session parameter, they have to use empty string to work aroud our API design.
    
    This PR allows `null` as a valid database name for session parameters, while disallows empty string as it is an invalid database name to users.

driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/SessionParametersTemplate.java
driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/SessionFactoryImpl.java
driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/SessionParameters.java
driver/src/test/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/SessionParametersTest.java

commit ba17bfe544fbb873f89153d2ce570392bfc18c39
Author: Petr Janouch <petr.janouch@neotechnology.com>
Date:   Fri May 3 16:16:09 2019 +0200

    Providing possibility to share event loops among driver instances
    
    Each driver instance creates its own even loop group, which is
    a very expensive resource that can be shared among drivers.
    
    This change provides a way how to construct a driver
    with a supplied event loop group

commit 0704e21aaf764bad69ae1f471ecb24e58c249ac7
Author: Petr Janouch <petr.janouch@neotechnology.com>
Date:   Thu Mar 14 15:21:07 2019 +0100

    Speeding up the shutdown of the driver.

driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/async/pool/ConnectionPoolImpl.java

commit 5d335cbc9f22d7d9d3e6403870e72baf41bb7efc
Author: Zhen Li <zhen.li@neotechnology.com>
Date:   Thu Apr 25 14:43:22 2019 +0200

    Driver should suppress subsequent connection errors into existing errors if any.
    When a server is shutting down, it is possible that a transaction is killed in the middle, followed by the termination of connection. Before the connection is shutting down, the server might send an error message if there is at least one pending message sent by client. However the server will also ignore any further messages that are queued in the server inbound message queue. Thus when the client trying to send or reading more with the closed connection, the client will receive a connection terminated error.
    
    This PR makes sure when the above situation happens, the client will throw the original error first.

driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/async/inbound/ChannelErrorHandler.java
driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/async/inbound/InboundMessageDispatcher.java

commit b6c65272457294d245a6a4ce88e188101fb3abb9
Author: Ali Ince <ali.ince@neotechnology.com>
Date:   Thu Apr 18 10:51:03 2019 +0100

    Change how BoltServerAddress equality works
    
    BoltServerAddress was checking equality on  `Hostname`, `Resolved IP` and `Port` triplet and DnsResolver was causing loss of original `Hostname`.
    
    This commit removed public access to resolved IP Address component of BoltServerAddress and removed it from the equality check, thus resulting in same `hostname:port` pairs equal whatever IP address it is resolved to.

commit fb45ba64dc00e86615521177e3d9ec3d7a739b86
Author: Zhen Li <zhen.li@neotechnology.com>
Date:   Tue Apr 9 15:31:18 2019 +0200

    Schedule reactive retries in Netty event loop thread pool.
    By default, Project Reactor schedules delayed operations on a parallel scheduler, which is created lazily when needed.
    We can avoid creating such an extra resource by schedule the delayed work on our existing netty event loop thread pool.
    This behaviour is exactly the same as our existing async retries.
    
    Added tests to verify that the Parallel scheduler is not created.

driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/retry/ExponentialBackoffRetryLogic.java
driver/src/test/java/org/neo4j/driver/integration/reactive/RxSessionIT.java
driver/src/test/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/retry/ExponentialBackoffRetryLogicTest.java
driver/src/test/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/util/ImmediateSchedulingEventExecutor.java

commit 75d8efcbe070e354e721b62d468954e847554e47
Merge: 2f2b281f 8e7840f7
Author: Ali Ince <ali-ince@users.noreply.github.com>

    Rename Bolt V4 Messages

commit 8e7840f7bc083ef38cccafc8a670fb7c600d3e38
Author: Zhen Li <zhen.li@neotechnology.com>
Date:   Fri Mar 22 15:40:45 2019 +0100

    Changed a few BoltV4 message formats:
    
    `PULL_N {n=Long, stmt_id=Long}` changed to `PULL {n=Long, qid=Long}`
    `PULL {n=-1, qid=Long}` is used as `PULL_ALL`
    
    `DISCARD_N {n=Long, stmt_id=Long}` changed to `DISCARD {n=Long, qid=Long}`
    
    `BEGIN {db_name=String, ...}` is changed to `BEGIN {db=String, ...}`
    `RUN {db_name=String, ...}` is changed to `RUN {db=String, ...}`

commit 162314ae72b031fdce53a8610d38d7ee980d30a8
Author: Zhen Li <zhen.li@neotechnology.com>
Date:   Sun Feb 17 14:48:29 2019 +0100

    The current design choice to build async on top of reactive pull_n handler may easily cause deadlock issues.
    As both async pull_n handler and reactive pull_n handler requires sync on all methods.
    
    It is too much effort building async pull handler on top of reactive pull_n handler.
    While most of the logic are almost the same excpet auto pull_n, which is the source of many deadlock problems.
    So changed back to use the old async pull handler.

    Race condition in when to PULL_N.

commit fcbf03c04f5455aa39e9b581a2313a9734dc9cb3
Author: Zhen Li <zhen.li@neotechnology.com>
Date:   Wed Oct 17 17:18:33 2018 +0200

    Added React API and Bolt V4
    
    Added PULL_N message for request n operation.
    Using DISCARD_ALL message for cancel operation.
    Bolt V4 will totally switch to PULL_N for retreving all records.
    While for back-compatibility, the driver still supports PULL_ALL for Bolt versions before Bolt V4.
    The result pulling logic is now built on top of pull handler, which uses consummer based callbacks.

commit 05370a62dab0d4db0df0bde3ca202d281debaddd
Author: Zhen Li <zhen.li@neotechnology.com>
Date:   Wed Feb 27 17:28:42 2019 +0100

    Fixed the bug where original host name is lost in ssl handshake.
    
    The driver resolves host address to IP addresses. In the scenarios with SNI, the original host name is required to be part of ssl handshake to indicate the server to connect to.
    Fixed the bug where driver uses IP address rather than the original host name in ssl handshake.

commit 82aa06d00d1a4959991b91499977dd62db4b8825
Author: lutovich <konstantin.lutovich@neo4j.com>
Date:   Wed Oct 24 16:23:46 2018 +0200

    More conventional config builder method names
    
    Added static factory method `ConfigBuilder Config#builder()` and
    instance method `Config ConfigBuilder#build()`. They have same
    behaviour as existing `ConfigBuilder Config#build()` and
    `Config ConfigBuilder#toConfig()` but have more conventional names.
    Existing methods not deprecated to avoid all existing user code be
    marked as deprecated. New methods also consistent with
    `TransactionConfig`. Updated the codebase to use new methods.

commit d3bd5ddbcd5fbeada83d1b28159b0c59d58ba414
Author: lutovich <konstantin.lutovich@neo4j.com>
Date:   Mon Oct 22 14:09:07 2018 +0200

    Execute TCK tests in parallel with other ITs
    
    TCK tests are executed using JUnit 4 because Cucumber does not support
    JUnit 5. This commit makes all TCK tests capable of running in parallel
    with other JUnit 5 ITs. New category is added which is treated the same
    as ITs annotated with `@ParallelizableIT`.

    Add maven profile to disable parallel ITs
    
    They can be disabled with `-DsequentialITs` system property.
    For example:
    
    ```
    mvn clean install -DsequentialITs
    ```

pom.xml

commit ac37eb3d46adc34d1578d12b5e7ab7441d044ef7
Author: lutovich <konstantin.lutovich@neo4j.com>
Date:   Fri Oct 19 15:52:59 2018 +0200

    Execute integration tests in parallel
    
    Use Maven failsafe plugin's JVM forking to execute integration tests in
    multiple JVMs in parallel. Every forked JVM has access to a unique ID system
    property. Value of this property is used to determine HTTP, HTTPS and Bolt
    ports for a test neo4j instance used for all tests in that JVM. Exery forked
    JVM will use its own separate neo4j instance. Ports start with a fixed offset
    because configuring neo4j to use system-assigned port is tricky. Code could
    specify port 0 for all connectors but then parsing of logs would be needed to
    know that actual port.
    
    JUnit 5 tags are used to mark integration tests that support parallelized
    execution. Every such test is marked with `@ParallelizableIT` annotation.
    Failsafe plugin has two executions - first all parallelizable tests, second
    all sequential tests (CC and stub server tests). TCK tests are executed in
    parallel with other ITs but use a dedicated JUnit 4 category.
    
    It is possible to disable parallel execution of integration tests using
    `-DsequentialITs` system property. Example:
    
    ```
    mvn clean install -DsequentialITs
    ```
    
    This change reduces the build time locally from ~ 35 minutes to ~ 25 minutes.

commit 346c1d248de3e8d5ae2a88fbfdbf55a93c472ac7
Merge: d6f1f862 7a79d06c
Author: Ali Ince <ali-ince@users.noreply.github.com>

    Improve stacktraces for errors from blocking API

commit 7a79d06c921bce8ba51efe61dd4a79b86b8a4198
Author: lutovich <konstantin.lutovich@neo4j.com>
Date:   Mon Oct 8 18:40:47 2018 +0200

    Improve stacktraces for errors from blocking API
    
    Blocking API works on top of async API and simply blocks on the
    returned futures. Exceptions can thus contain stacktraces unrelated
    to the user's code because they originate from driver worker threads.
    Such exceptions make it hard for users of the driver to determine what
    has caused the error.
    
    This commit makes exceptions thrown from blocking API calls contain
    stacktraces of the current thread. Original async stacktrace is
    attached in a dummy suppressed exception.

driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/util/ErrorUtil.java
driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/util/Futures.java
driver/src/test/java/org/neo4j/driver/v1/integration/ErrorIT.java
driver/src/test/java/org/neo4j/driver/v1/integration/TransactionIT.java

    Include database connection ID in debug logs

    message response. This commit makes driver extract the supplied
    ID and include it in all debug log messages. This makes it possible
    to trace events on the same connection between driver and database.

Author: lutovich <konstantin.lutovich@neo4j.com>
Date:   Thu Sep 27 14:20:10 2018 +0200

    Consume query results in stress test
    
    Not consuming them can make the database stop accepting new commands
    because its outgoing network buffer is too full. Clients are expected
    to consume results within reasonable time, otherwise database can
    disable auto-read for the connection.

commit 6bbb3440a00c0726b20253756bab3d3918469313
Merge: 9b498981 3d56c394
Author: Ali Ince <ali-ince@users.noreply.github.com>

commit 8a0fed5fcaa46260a32c224041b66db50704f05f
Author: Zhen Li <zhen.li@neotechnology.com>

commit 3d56c3949a641e07d328fe611cf2bde9b1e7b71a
Author: lutovich <konstantin.lutovich@neo4j.com>
Date:   Mon Sep 17 13:45:23 2018 +0200

    Use composite cumulator for message decoding
    
    `MessageDecoder` is responsible for assembling full Bolt messages. It
    accumulates bytes until an empty chunk is received. Empty chunk signals
    a message boundary. It used to copy all received chunks into a larger
    buffer every time. This resulted in an increased memory usage when
    receiving large results.
    
    This commit makes `MessageDecoder` store all received chunks in a
    composite buffer. No buffer copying is done. It is achieved by
    using a different non-default byte buffer cumulator. System property
    "messageDecoderCumulator" can be used to make decoder use the default
    copying/merging cumulator "-DmessageDecoderCumulator=merge".

driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/async/inbound/MessageDecoder.java

    Used ChannelGroup to keep track of all alive channels.

commit b33d284ef6f350edbfe9e8f4539cdcdb0200bd0b
Merge: b639b18b 050a0c3d
Author: Konstantin Lutovich <konstantin.lutovich@neo4j.com>
Date:   Wed Sep 12 11:37:34 2018 +0200

    Merge pull request #528 from lutovich/1.6-tx-with-nested-queries
    
    Ensure a single handler manages channel's auto-read

commit 050a0c3d956ea1a3f4d6e4ec1173e05fb8cc6e25
Author: lutovich <konstantin.lutovich@neo4j.com>
Date:   Tue Sep 11 19:09:14 2018 +0200

    Disable the removed auto-read managing handler
    
    To make sure it does not influence the auto-read status of the channel.
    Also restore default value of auto-read for channel when such handler
    is removed.
    
    This change is needed to avoid removing a handler that has just
    disabled auto-read. This is possible when handler receives a RECORD
    that causes it to disable auto-read and then receives a SUCCESS
    message, which causes it to be dequeued with auto-read being disabled.

driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/async/inbound/InboundMessageDispatcher.java
driver/src/test/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/async/inbound/InboundMessageDispatcherTest.java

commit 78cf1e3b5d27ee24862d0ec6811e41d83f3c95dd
Author: lutovich <konstantin.lutovich@neo4j.com>
Date:   Tue Sep 11 10:58:48 2018 +0200

    Forget auto-read managing handler when it is dequeued
    
    Make sure `InboundMessageDispatcher` does not hold on to the last
    auto-read management handler after it is removed from the queue of
    all handlers.

driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/async/inbound/InboundMessageDispatcher.java
driver/src/test/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/async/inbound/InboundMessageDispatcherTest.java

commit 5c968ca887e30138794411bef461559bd3cab819
Author: lutovich <konstantin.lutovich@neo4j.com>
Date:   Mon Sep 10 12:25:11 2018 +0200

    Ensure a single handler manages channel's auto-read
    
    `PullAllResponseHandler` is responsible for receiving a stream of
    records. Stream might be very large and handler tries to not fetch
    if fully into memory. It applies a network-level backpressure by
    disabling/enabling auto-read property of the underlying Netty channel.
    This property tells channel to not read from the network. Auto-read is
    disabled when number of queued records goes beyond the threshold.
    
    Management of auto-read turned out to be problematic for nested
    queries within a single transaction. Nested queries result in
    multiple `PullAllResponseHandler`s being added to the queue of
    handlers. They will try to manage auto-read concurrently and can
    sometimes disable it completely. Callers would then be blocked
    and unable to proceed. This is not a problem for `Session#run()`
    because every such call ensures there was a logical SYNC and the
    previous query has completed and its result is buffered.
    
    This commit fixes a problem by making only a single installed handler
    manage the channel's auto-read property. Making sure there only exists
    a single such handler is the responsibility of
    `InboundMessageDispatcher`. Auto-read is enabled when new auto-read
    managing handler is installed. Previous such handler is disabled.

driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/async/inbound/InboundMessageDispatcher.java
driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/handlers/PullAllResponseHandler.java
driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/spi/AutoReadManagingResponseHandler.java
driver/src/test/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/async/inbound/InboundMessageDispatcherTest.java

Date:   Wed Sep 5 17:26:29 2018 +0200

    This simplifies `ExplicitTransaction` a bit by removing all bookmark
    handling from it.

driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/ExplicitTransaction.java

commit 86cf222ac0d08bbac41664a5c60bf3053f9e4eef
Author: lutovich <konstantin.lutovich@neo4j.com>
Date:   Tue Sep 4 16:17:21 2018 +0200

    Keep bookmark returned after auto-commit tx
    
    Auto-commit transactions return bookmarks in Bolt V3. They were
    previously unused. This commit makes driver extract such bookmarks
    and expose them via `Session#lastBookmark()`. It then possible for
    explicit and auto-commit transactions within the same session to be
    chained with bookmarks.

driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/v1/Logger.java

commit 864c01f332c58c862dfd875c94ca8d4529721bea
Author: lutovich <konstantin.lutovich@neo4j.com>
Date:   Wed Aug 29 17:07:14 2018 +0200

    Allow conversion of statement result to stream
    
    Queries executed via blocking API return `StatementResult` which is an
    iterable of records. This commit adds a convenience method
    `StatementResult#stream()` to convert result to a stream. It should
    be convenient to use this method when processing of returned records
    is required.
    
    Example:
    
    ```
    List<Integer> list = session.run("UNWIND range(1, 100) AS x RETURN x")
                                .stream()
                                .map(record -> record.get("x"))
                                .map(Value::asInt)
                                .collect(toList());
    ```

driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/InternalStatementResult.java
driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/v1/StatementResult.java
driver/src/test/java/org/neo4j/driver/v1/integration/ResultStreamIT.java

commit 26b72f513819b818e0ae4b84405ca53ddbed60cf
Author: lutovich <konstantin.lutovich@neo4j.com>
Date:   Wed Aug 29 16:05:02 2018 +0200

    Allow streams as query parameters
    
    They will get converted to lists, same as iterables and iterators.
    
    Example:
    
    ```
    Stream<Integer> stream = Stream.of(1, 2, 3, 4, 5);
    StatementResult result = session.run("UNWIND $xs AS x RETURN x", singletonMap("xs", stream));
    ```

commit 01d7dda8303c1464a53632e54a6ad3a3170cb48d
Author: lutovich <konstantin.lutovich@neo4j.com>
Date:   Wed Aug 29 14:32:14 2018 +0200

    Allow driver to accept and return OffsetDateTime
    
    Which is another variant of representing `DateTime` with zone offset
    Cypher type. Before this change, driver could only represent such
    `DateTime` values with `ZonedDateTime`. It is now possible to pass
    `OffsetDateTime` as a query parameter and convert the returned value
    to it.

commit c81da496c200438335821e75afa364b371439649
Author: lutovich <konstantin.lutovich@neo4j.com>
Date:   Thu Jul 26 18:05:02 2018 +0200

    Expose transaction timeout and metadata in the API
    
    This is the first draft of the API to allow transaction timeout and/or
    metadata be set for explicit and auto-commit transactions. Both
    settings can be specified in a `TransactionConfig` object which can be
    created like this:
    
    ```
    TransactionConfig config = TransactionConfig.builder()
                .withTimeout(Duration.ofSeconds(5))
                .withMetadata(Collections.singletonMap("key", "value"))
                .build();
    ```
    
    Explicit transactions can take config like this:
    
    ```
    Transaction tx = session.beginTransaction(config);
    ```
    
    and auto-commit transactions accept it in various overloads of
    `Session#run()` and `Session#runAsync()`:
    
    ```
    session.run("CREATE ()", config);
    
    session.runAsync("RETURN $x", Collections.singletonMap("x", 1) config);
    ```
    
    Transaction functions accept config like this:
    
    ```
    session.readTransaction(tx -> {...}, config);
    
    session.writeTransactionAsync(tx -> {...}, config);
    ```
    
    There also exists a possibility to specify default transaction
    configuration per driver. It can be configured in the driver's config:
    
    ```
    Config driverConfig = Config.build()
                .withDefaultTransactionConfig(txConfig)
                .toConfig();
    ```
    
    More tests and javadocs will be added in subsequent commits.

commit bb31f06f461b4030295ebd635a69a844d4304670
Author: lutovich <konstantin.lutovich@neo4j.com>
Date:   Thu Jul 26 12:29:54 2018 +0200

    Fix handing of response metadata in Bolt V3
    
    Metadata keys are different in previous versions of the protocol.
    This commit makes it possible for keys to be defined by each Bolt
    protocol implementation.
    
    Also fixed couple unit tests and added license headers.

Date:   Wed Jul 25 16:35:17 2018 +0200

    Messaging part of Bolt V3
    
    Added new messages and ability to write them into a network channel.
    Introduced Bolt V3 abstraction that uses new messages to execute
    execute queries, begin/commit/rollback transactions.
    
    Code does not yet use new metadata.

driver/src/test/java/org/neo4j/driver/v1/integration/TransactionIT.java

commit 316f3cc51f786d43dcf0ae58797b47b733683eb8
Author: lutovich <konstantin.lutovich@neo4j.com>
Date:   Tue Jul 24 15:51:34 2018 +0200

    Wait for all errors to arrive before closing tx
    
    Results of all queries need to be consumed before transaction is
    committed or rolled back. This is done by `ResultCursorsHolder`
    which keeps all cursors and queries them for errors. Previously,
    it only waited for the first failure to arrive and there might've
    been some more queries receiving results.
    
    This commit fixes the problem by making the `ResultCursorsHolder`
    properly await for all result cursors to be consumed. It does not do
    blocking await but structures the result future to only be completed
    when all results have arrived.

driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/async/ResultCursorsHolder.java
driver/src/test/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/async/ResultCursorsHolderTest.java

commit ccd6ef7f59d9273335acb84a132a2828e380d506
Author: lutovich <konstantin.lutovich@neo4j.com>
Date:   Tue Jul 24 14:36:11 2018 +0200

    Treat transaction as rolled back after any failure
    
    Every failure is now "acknowledged" by sending a RESET message. It
    makes database cleanup the state of the transaction and forget about
    it. Thus every failure is fatal and transaction can't execute more
    queries or commit.
    
    This commit makes every failure treated as fatal for transactions.

driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/ExplicitTransaction.java
driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/handlers/TransactionPullAllResponseHandler.java

    Create BoltProtocol abstraction
    
    To encapsulate all Bolt protocol version specific operations under a
    single interface. This should make it easier to introduce Bolt V3
    which contains multiple new messages.

commit 4e2abe97449dd82d7a28c178f441b20edb4c9353
Author: lutovich <konstantin.lutovich@neo4j.com>

    Tiny simplification of BeginTxResponseHandler

commit 07a84ca847c36a4f37dd5852f1058dd3ee9a5717
Author: lutovich <konstantin.lutovich@neo4j.com>
Date:   Thu Jul 19 15:23:53 2018 +0200

    Allow easier request message versioning
    
    Replaced double dispatch approach with a set of configurable message
    encoders. Later allows easier addition of new message types because
    double dispatch was locked to specific messages.
    
    Introduced `ValuePacker` and `ValueUnpacker` components responsible for
    reading and writing structs, like node, relationship, date-time or
    point. Previously, logic of handling structs was coupled with message
    writer/reader.

commit 4cc5fda26c56b59fb644a879715a43e653131ed2
Author: lutovich <konstantin.lutovich@neo4j.com>
Date:   Mon Jul 2 18:17:30 2018 +0200

    Improve neo4j feature detection in tests
    
    Some tests are only relevant for all neo4j versions which have a
    particular feature. This was previously checked using assumptions
    and neo4j version comparisons. This commit adds a JUnit 5 test
    execution condition which is based on neo4j feature. Every test
    can be enabled/disabled based on presence/absence of a feature
    specified in an annotation.

driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/util/ServerVersion.java

commit ec293e599c797b1230cd1003d1700f0cec4ad57c
Author: lutovich <konstantin.lutovich@neo4j.com>
Date:   Wed Jun 20 15:16:17 2018 +0200

    Configurable server address resolver
    
    This commit makes it possible to configure a resolver function used by
    the routing driver. Such function is used during the initial discovery
    and when all known routers have failed. Driver already had an internal
    facility like this which performed a DNS lookup for the hostname of
    the initial address. This remains the default. Users are now able to
    provide a custom resolver in the config.

driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/BoltServerAddress.java
driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/DriverFactory.java
driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/cluster/DnsResolver.java

commit 18becc39c47d0308e398c9e7f56dce75ea9a8a1c
Merge: c5e8da6b d7225861

    Fix handling of large chunks

commit d7225861e00712c8be7963ec7e95adc5ed029b83
Author: lutovich <konstantin.lutovich@neo4j.com>
Date:   Sun Jun 3 13:40:25 2018 +0200

    Add ITs for long lists, byte arrays and strings

driver/src/test/java/org/neo4j/driver/v1/integration/ParametersIT.java
driver/src/test/java/org/neo4j/driver/v1/tck/DriverComplianceSteps.java
driver/src/test/java/org/neo4j/driver/v1/util/TestUtil.java

commit e691bef9db9fd2fec3a554fde8301a0ec28c8afd
Author: lutovich <konstantin.lutovich@neo4j.com>
Date:   Sun Jun 3 13:10:57 2018 +0200

    Fix handling of codec exceptions without cause
    
    Driver tries to extract cause of every `CodecException` received in
    `#exceptionCaught(Throwable)` netty callbacks. It did not handle
    cases when the cause is null, which resulted in an attempt to
    exceptionally complete a `CompletableFuture` with null.
    
    This commit fixes the problem by making handlers extract the exception
    cause only if it is defined and propagate the original error otherwise.

driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/async/HandshakeHandler.java
driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/async/inbound/ChannelErrorHandler.java
driver/src/test/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/async/ChannelErrorHandlerTest.java
driver/src/test/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/async/HandshakeHandlerTest.java

commit 1b8c4bbb191be87985644caa10f45f04f16c85b4
Author: lutovich <konstantin.lutovich@neo4j.com>
Date:   Sun Jun 3 13:01:06 2018 +0200

    Allow chunks of size 65535
    
    Driver used to only accept chunks of size 32767. This was a limitation
    on the total chunk size, which includes a 2 byte length header and
    body. However, Bolt protocol specification allows chunks with body
    of size 65535 (0xFFFF).
    
    This commit fixes the problem by making `ChunkDecoder` accept chunks
    of size 65535 + 2.

driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/async/inbound/ChunkDecoder.java
driver/src/test/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/async/inbound/ChunkDecoderTest.java

commit f0de1de630cb8eab783edcc0e5a0648a6a434b18

commit c5e8da6b8aa50d68dfa8413fa44c95913877eacd
Merge: 55d6fa46 4a4409d1
Author: Konstantin Lutovich <konstantin.lutovich@neotechnology.com>
Date:   Thu May 31 10:49:57 2018 +0200

    Merge pull request #504 from lutovich/1.6-failure-on-reset-and-ack-failure
    
    Improve handling of RESET and ACK_FAILURE errors

commit 4a4409d104a78c72dc64d16dae942321fce7c5b3
Author: lutovich <konstantin.lutovich@neo4j.com>
Date:   Mon May 21 23:26:38 2018 +0200

    Improve handling of RESET and ACK_FAILURE errors
    
    This commit makes driver close the network channel when either `RESET`
    or `ACK_FAILURE` receive an error response. Message `RESET` is sent
    before release of the channel back to the channel pool. It might fail
    if database experiences a fatal error (like `OutOfMemoryError`) or a
    network failure occurs. In case of such errors channel will be closed
    and returned to the pool, which will drop it later. Message
    `ACK_FAILURE` is sent to acknowledge a `FAILURE` response. Failure
    to do so is unrecoverable and should result in a connection
    being dropped.

driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/async/inbound/InboundMessageDispatcher.java
driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/handlers/AckFailureResponseHandler.java

driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/handlers/ResetResponseHandler.java

commit 9b41553bedcb2dde6d5b0aea0d7fe2cc8bb7811c
Author: lutovich <konstantin.lutovich@neo4j.com>
Date:   Wed May 23 12:48:08 2018 +0200

    Skip hostname verification IT on neo4j < 3.2
    
    Because these self-signed certificate is generated based on the listen
    address and not advertised address. This results in an unexpected
    "Common Name" (CN) field in the certificate and makes hostname
    verification fail.
    
    This fixes the previous incorrect < 3.1 condition.

examples/src/test/java/org/neo4j/docs/driver/ExamplesIT.java

    Skip hostname verification IT on neo4j < 3.1
    
    Because these self-signed certificate is generated based on the listen
    address and not advertised address. This results in an unexpected
    "Common Name" (CN) field in the certificate and makes hostname
    verification fail.

commit e684d9f84c2579d4b905f0fbeaeb218612ca609e
Merge: 35950495 9950b2ce
Author: Zhen Li <zhenlineo@users.noreply.github.com>

commit 9950b2ce992681e2e82e9855c93c896d436931bf

Date:   Thu May 17 17:41:59 2018 +0200

    Common Name (CN). This breaks subsequent tests that try to
    do hostname verification because they expect `CN=localhost`.

driver/src/test/java/org/neo4j/driver/v1/tck/DriverComplianceIT.java

commit f46d0899d5faaab2b9fd3a930e76f6b774c46ce3
Author: lutovich <konstantin.lutovich@neo4j.com>
Date:   Wed May 16 18:32:58 2018 +0200

    Support hostname verification for secure connections
    
    Hostname verification makes client verify that server it is trying to
    connect to matches server specified in the returned certificate. This
    is a way to protect from man in the middle attack and make sure client
    is talking to the correct server. Hostname will be compared to all
    entries in `subjectAltName` field of the certificate.
    
    This commit makes driver support configurable hostname verification. It
    can be configured together with the trust strategy:
    
    ```
    Config config = Config.build()
        .withTrustStrategy(trustAllCertificates().withHostnameVerification())
        .toConfig();
    ```
    
    Method `#withHostnameVerification()` is available for all trust
    strategies. Verification is turned off by default.

driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/DriverFactory.java
driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/async/NettyChannelInitializer.java
driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/security/SecurityPlan.java
driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/v1/Config.java

commit 79627feb671183418e62d44cc5db7570ef18c4e6
Author: lutovich <konstantin.lutovich@neo4j.com>
Date:   Thu May 17 12:57:58 2018 +0200

    Update license headers after rebase

driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/logging/Slf4jLogger.java

commit 71fe386485cc4e962b3ec1170ce7e90807b8b6b5
Author: lutovich <konstantin.lutovich@neo4j.com>
Date:   Mon May 14 21:53:48 2018 +0200

    Add more logging docs, SLF4J support and public factories
    
    All logging implementations live in an internal package. They are not
    expected to be used by the client code. Previously, every client needed
    it's own implementation of `Logging` and `Logger` interfaces in order
    to use driver logging without relying on internal APIs.
    
    This commit introduces public API for creating logging implementations.
    This API consists of static factory methods on the `Logging` interface.
    They allow users to create console logging with the specified level,
    JUL logging with the specified level, dev-null logging and new SLF4J
    logging. Later only works when SLF4J implementation is in the
    classpath/modulepath. SLF4J is itself an optional dependency and thus
    is not pulled transitively my Maven. Majority of projects use some SLF4J
    implementation like Logback or Log4j and will be able to redirect driver
    logging to the configured location.
    
    Also added more javadocs around driver logging interfaces.

driver/pom.xml
driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/logging/ConsoleLogging.java

commit 1cf40b7341738f0cb01b8abb1897bb1294aae9f3
Merge: 05c451a1 edc09ce2
Author: Zhen Li <zhenlineo@users.noreply.github.com>
Date:   Mon May 7 16:53:19 2018 +0200

    Merge pull request #497 from lutovich/1.6-ns-normalization
    
    Handle nanosecond normalization in IsoDuration

commit edc09ce2c21efeab3d7282d8b3a9332d1a0f9a5a
Author: lutovich <konstantin.lutovich@neo4j.com>
Date:   Mon May 7 15:02:00 2018 +0200

    Handle nanosecond normalization in IsoDuration
    
    Database normalizes nanoseconds to be in range from 0 to 999_999_999.
    `IsoDuration` previously did no calculations in it's `#toString()`
    and returned incorrect result.
    
    This commit makes it return correct string representation despite
    normalized second and nanosecond components. It will also do
    normalization in the constructor using
    `java.time.Duration#ofSeconds(long, long)` in order to return correct
    strings for durations created on the client side and not returned
    from the database.

driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/InternalIsoDuration.java
driver/src/test/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/InternalIsoDurationTest.java
driver/src/test/java/org/neo4j/driver/v1/integration/TemporalTypesIT.java

commit 112ff4131d4a8a2969be30cf2b57df61f1ba3e5a
Author: lutovich <konstantin.lutovich@neo4j.com>
Date:   Mon May 7 14:23:18 2018 +0200

    Create random durations with positive nanoseconds
    
    Previously, test code that generated random durations could create a
    duration with negative amount of nanoseconds. Such duration is now
    normalized by the database so that nanoseconds value is always in
    range from 0 to 999_999_999.
    
    This commit makes tests only create random durations with nanoseconds
    in that range. Otherwise some test assertions fail because they expect
    non-normalized value to be returned back.

driver/src/test/java/org/neo4j/driver/v1/util/TemporalUtil.java

commit c0790381f3b62a68ab7d8ced18734f215a27f445
Merge: f381a38e 8da816d2

commit f381a38e041f89b01015200182ef9a4c4183a123
Merge: f6c4e9b0 d621df46
Author: Ali Ince <ali-ince@users.noreply.github.com>
Date:   Tue Apr 24 16:54:24 2018 +0100

    Merge pull request #493 from lutovich/1.6-startup-logging
    
    Log driver's hashCode during startup and shutdown

commit d621df460e8b5d75bb3aee5b011470edf5a4b007
Author: lutovich <konstantin.lutovich@neo4j.com>
Date:   Tue Apr 24 15:48:09 2018 +0200

    Log driver's hashCode during startup and shutdown
    
    Previously, driver logged its fully qualified class name and hash code
    when created or closed. Example:
    
    ```
    Direct driver instance o.n.d.i.InternalDriver@30316b44 created for server address localhost:7687
    Closing driver instance o.n.d.i.InternalDriver@30316b44
    ```
    
    Class name does not seem to be useful and this commit replaces it with
    logging of the hash code. Example:
    
    ```
    Direct driver instance 808545092 created for server address localhost:7687
    Closing driver instance 808545092
    ```

driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/DriverFactory.java
driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/InternalDriver.java

commit 8da816d240a74225361e3db2968e4eeac19943ed
Author: lutovich <konstantin.lutovich@neo4j.com>
Date:   Tue Apr 24 11:20:07 2018 +0200

    Reduce code duplication in statement runners
    
    Interface `StatementRunner` defines methods for running cypher queries
    with different forms of parameters. It is implemented by both session
    and transaction. Both used to implement overloads of `#run()` and
    `#runAsync()` in a similar way.
    
    This commit adds an abstract class for session and transaction so that
    they only need to implement a single `#run(Statement)` and
    `#runAsync(Statement)`.

driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/AbstractStatementRunner.java
driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/ExplicitTransaction.java
driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/NetworkSession.java
driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/util/Extract.java

commit f6c4e9b0154760b1b9229bb43d2ba731ba0cf41b
Merge: f1d4ea22 96d3b25d
Author: Zhen Li <zhenlineo@users.noreply.github.com>

    Simplified toString() for duration

commit f1d4ea2206be506a11bd183552f31a8411f97016
Merge: bccc2341 f9e41d49
Author: Konstantin Lutovich <konstantin.lutovich@neotechnology.com>
Date:   Mon Apr 23 11:18:57 2018 +0200

    Merge pull request #489 from zhenlineo/1.6-paramter-check
    
    Revert the check of node, rel, and path in Values#value

commit 96d3b25d02f7d90bde885d91730dcbf821e09458
Author: lutovich <konstantin.lutovich@neo4j.com>
Date:   Fri Apr 20 23:29:18 2018 +0200

    Simplified toString() for duration
    
    Previously it normalized duration in order to expose a more
    human-friendly string. For example, 7 days would become a week,
    12 months would become a year. It seems nice but might create a
    false impression that it is possible to retrieve weeks and years
    from an `IsoDuration` object. However, it only supports months,
    days, seconds and nanoseconds. Also, other drivers do not normalize
    durations.
    
    This commit makes `IsoDuration#toString()` simply concatenate all
    values into a string as is. Resulting string will only contain months,
    days, seconds and nanoseconds. Zero values are not filtered out. So
    returned ISO strings represent exactly same durations but in different
    format.

driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/InternalIsoDuration.java
driver/src/test/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/InternalIsoDurationTest.java

driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/v1/StatementRunner.java

commit 87a46c8da79266a78b1f5600754a0ed35c462795
Author: lutovich <konstantin.lutovich@neotechnology.com>
Date:   Mon Apr 9 19:24:21 2018 +0200

    Check for fatal errors last in the transaction
    
    Fatal errors terminate the transaction. It will fail to commit when
    terminated and rollback will be a no-op. All outstanding errors from
    previous queries should still be propagated.
    
    Previously transaction checked it's terminated status too early and
    sometimes did not propagate pending errors. This commit fixes the
    problem by moving the termination check to a place where all result
    cursors are fully fetched. So errors from cursors will always get
    propagated.
    
    Also added a constant for default `RoutingSettings` for convenience.

driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/ExplicitTransaction.java
driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/cluster/RoutingSettings.java
driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/v1/Config.java
driver/src/test/java/org/neo4j/driver/v1/integration/SessionResetIT.java
driver/src/test/java/org/neo4j/driver/v1/integration/TransactionAsyncIT.java

commit dc9b272cc65e02d335fc43dc6398ceb25e300815
Author: lutovich <konstantin.lutovich@neotechnology.com>
Date:   Mon Apr 9 17:46:11 2018 +0200

    Wrap IOException in ServiceUnavailableException
    
    When establishing connection it was possible for `IOException` to get
    propagated directly to the user without being wrapped in a
    `ServiceUnavailableException`. This happened because `HandshakeHandler`
    only wrapped security-related exceptions with driver exceptions. It was
    problematic because rest of the codebase expects to deal with
    `ServiceUnavailableException`s. For example rediscovery and retries
    code can deal nicely with `ServiceUnavailableException`.
    
    This commit fixes the problem by making `HandshakeHandler` wrap all
    non-security related exceptions in `ServiceUnavailableException`.

driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/async/HandshakeHandler.java
driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/async/inbound/ChannelErrorHandler.java
driver/src/test/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/async/ChannelConnectorImplIT.java
driver/src/test/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/async/HandshakeHandlerTest.java

commit af8c5b7551673b6e49c62b60a1c06424586ecb89
Author: Zhen Li <zhen.li@neotechnology.com>
Date:   Wed Apr 4 16:25:17 2018 +0200

    Adding more checks around the allowed input parameter types
    
    The input parameters could be of type:
    * Map<String, Object>
    * Record
    * MapValue generated via Values#parameters
    * MapValue
    
    If the input parameters are provided by a Map<String, Object> or Record, or Values#parameters, then any unsupported types will be captured via Values#value.
    
    If the input parameters are provided by a MapValue directly, then any unsupported types will be captured at PackStream#pack.

commit a355fc4360849ea8fc8a8965ffd63d268c574dd4
Author: lutovich <konstantin.lutovich@neotechnology.com>
Date:   Wed Mar 14 11:15:13 2018 +0100

    Create IsoDuration from Period and Duration
    
    Driver represents duration as a custom `IsoDuration` interface. It's a
    combination of date-based amount and time-based amount. This commit
    makes driver accept `java.time.Period` and `java.time.Duration` as
    parameters and convert them to `IsoDuration`.

driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/InternalIsoDuration.java
driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/v1/Values.java
driver/src/test/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/InternalIsoDurationTest.java
driver/src/test/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/ValuesTest.java

commit bb31fc02532fc16ac9d164fc26ed622974d74a0b
Author: lutovich <konstantin.lutovich@neotechnology.com>
Date:   Tue Mar 13 23:47:25 2018 +0100

    Renamed custom Duration to IsoDuration
    
    So it does not clash with `java.time.Duration` and specifies that
    it's a combination of date-based amount and time-based amount.

commit 9965b6246ddb571fcc36a5899ae5e2dccd8dfc1c
Author: lutovich <konstantin.lutovich@neotechnology.com>
Date:   Wed Mar 7 10:59:22 2018 +0100

    Support for Duration Cypher type
    
    Driver is now able to send and receive instances of Duration type.
    They are represented as instances of custom `org.neo4j.driver.v1.types.Duration`
    interface. It's needed because Cypher's duration contains months, days,
    seconds and nanoseconds. There exists no default class in `java.time`
    package to represent a combination of these temporal values.

driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/InternalDuration.java
driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/messaging/PackStreamMessageFormatV2.java
driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/types/InternalTypeSystem.java
driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/types/TypeConstructor.java
driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/value/DurationValue.java
driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/value/ValueAdapter.java

commit 9e709e4343850f1b7dc8994023cfd655e279cc1d
Author: lutovich <konstantin.lutovich@neotechnology.com>
Date:   Tue Mar 6 16:49:07 2018 +0100

    Support for DateTime Cypher type
    
    Driver is now able to send and receive instances of DateTime type.
    They are represented as `java.time.ZonedDateTime` objects.
    `ZonedDateTime` instances contain time zone information either as
    numeric offset or as a zone id/name.

Date:   Mon Mar 5 15:00:25 2018 +0100

    Fixed a bug found on idle and inUse counters
    Before we always decrement idle counters when a channel is closed. However, this is wrong when a channel is closed before it is returen to the pool.
    So change the code to make sure that no matter the channel is closed inside or outside the pool, the idle and inUse counters should be correct.

commit 26fd3347975b8267341c540c266aad0f9437ffa0
Author: lutovich <konstantin.lutovich@neotechnology.com>
Date:   Fri Feb 9 15:08:26 2018 +0100

    New types for 2D and 3D points
    
    Introduced new types for points instead of a single generic interface
    that represents an arbitrary-dimensional point. This makes it cleaner
    what kind of points are supported by the database. It also removes the
    need for coordinate array creation and removes the `Coordinate`
    interface all together.

    Expose point type with Bolt V2

    change before the next stable release.

commit 730ef891844bb4f381f84bbc4a1e56c09286035c
Merge: cc526696 50ee9957
Author: lutovich <konstantin.lutovich@neotechnology.com>

commit f7ceaa2a5f119dbf976e7a5586650489d0f342c6
Author: lutovich <konstantin.lutovich@neotechnology.com>
Date:   Fri Jan 26 23:00:21 2018 +0100

    Create less direct drivers in CC integration test
    
    Previously CC test infrastructure create new direct driver for
    every "management" operation. This became quite expensive with
    1.5 because each driver needs to allocate Netty resources.
    Tests became quite long running.
    
    This commit introduces a lazy cache of direct drivers. Cache keeps
    a map from cluster member to direct driver. Less driver instances
    are created and tests run faster.

driver/src/test/java/org/neo4j/driver/v1/integration/CausalClusteringIT.java

commit 7310fdf7382ddb30b70d4a75f6bfb490b327374d
Author: lutovich <konstantin.lutovich@neotechnology.com>
Date:   Fri Jan 26 15:51:51 2018 +0100

    Unflake couple CC integration tests
    
    New test 'shouldKeepOperatingWhenConnectionsBreak' was flaky because
    it's reads sometimes failed with `EntityNotFoundException`. Test itself
    does not remove any nodes. It stepped on transactions created by
    previous data cleanup that is executed between tests. That cleanup
    did not actually wait for all cluster members to observe removals.
    This commit makes cleanup procedure use bookmark and count nodes on
    all cluster members.

driver/src/test/java/org/neo4j/driver/v1/integration/CausalClusteringIT.java

commit efd4b7177638314dafcc468482f5d94202000559
Author: lutovich <konstantin.lutovich@neotechnology.com>
Date:   Thu Jan 25 18:45:01 2018 +0100

    Do not close connections concurrently in tests
    
    Couple CC integration tests tried to simulate connection breakage by
    closing connections concurrently from a different thread. This was
    wrong because connections are not thread safe. It resulted in flaky
    tests.
    
    This commit replaces concurrent closing with just throwing errors
    from RUN and RESET. Connections with such errors will still be
    considered broken.

driver/src/test/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/util/ConnectionTrackingConnector.java
driver/src/test/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/util/ConnectionTrackingDriverFactory.java

commit c1cd7a2a68aae01ac157dc808280184d5b6a6359
Author: lutovich <konstantin.lutovich@neotechnology.com>
Date:   Thu Jan 25 14:09:47 2018 +0100

    POM cleanups & improvements
    
    Notable changes:
     * moved licence header file to root of the project and made examples
       and driver modules reference it; so it's now possible to invoke
       `mvn license:format` form both submodules
     * added all dependencies to parent pom's `dependencyManagement`
       section and removed unneeded 'scope' and 'version'
     * added all plugins to parent pom's `pluginManagement` to keep their
       versions in one place
     * moved duplicated plugins from examples and driver to parent pom and
       added overrides, where needed
     * removed references on `tools.jar` because it does not exist in JDK9
     * added 'java9' profile that sets compiler source and target to 9;
       profile is automatically activated when build is executed with JDK9
     * introduced 'Automatic-Module-Name: org.neo4j.driver' entry in the
       manifest file to set the stable automatic module name for JDK9
     * upgraded all plugin versions and test dependencies
     * made compiler plugin print warnings and deprecations

build/license-header.txt
driver/pom.xml
examples/pom.xml
pom.xml

commit 5864fb6626ea4e75b75e24d74d71f11d956f4d4b
Merge: bdb51bf5 b0d0935e
Author: Zhen Li <zhenlineo@users.noreply.github.com>
Date:   Tue Jan 23 16:42:42 2018 +0100

commit f024d8bcb4a98f5701e5f5ae82cf74b2b9ebd5f6
Author: lutovich <konstantin.lutovich@neotechnology.com>
Date:   Tue Jan 23 13:40:27 2018 +0100

    Fixed issue with connection pool deactivation
    
    Previously load balancer moved connection pool to deactivated state when
    corresponding cluster member had a network error. This was made to
    disallow any new connections towards that member. Member has also been
    removed from the routing table, so that callers never try to acquire
    connection from a deactivated pool. Deactivated pools were
    re-activated during rediscovery.
    
    However, there was a case when deactivated pool towards the seed router
    would remain deactivated forever without a chance to be re-activated.
    It happened when connections to all cores failed and driver had to
    perform rediscovery using seed router. In this case all connections
    pools were deactivated, and rediscovery was not able to complete
    because it failed trying to obtain connection from a deactivated pool.
    
    This commit fixes the problem by removing pool activation/deactivation.
    Instead driver will simply make instance non-routable by removing it's
    address from the routing table. Corresponding connection pool will not
    be changed. Later rediscovery will cleanup pools for non-routable
    addresses that have no active connections.

driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/cluster/ClusterRoutingTable.java
driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/cluster/LoadBalancer.java
driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/cluster/RoutingTable.java
