commit 4357602b01d6104ac63db74d6de2f417deb30261
Author: lutovich <konstantin.lutovich@neotechnology.com>
Date:   Wed Jul 5 16:38:42 2017 +0200

    Added least connected load balancing strategy
    
    This replaces the existing round-robin. It gives us better performance
    with clusters composed of different machine capacities.
    Lease connected load balancing strategy selects start index in
    round-robin fashion to avoid always selecting same machine when cluster
    does not have any running transactions or
    all machines have same number of active connections.

driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/cluster/LeastConnectedLoadBalancingStrategy.java
driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/cluster/LoadBalancer.java

commit ab54cc5b4efe53f737b76eda6f81b6d3ed9eb32b
Author: lutovich <konstantin.lutovich@neotechnology.com>
Date:   Tue Jul 4 12:28:26 2017 +0200

    Decouple load balancing logic from address set
    
    Round-robin load balancing was previously coupled with the address
    set implementation and made it hard to use different load balancing
    algorithm.
    
    This commit turns RoundRobinAddressSet into a simple concurrent set of
    addresses and moves load balancing logic into a separate component that
    takes list of available addresses and returns one that should be used
    next. This allows easier implementation of new load balancing
    algorithms. Rediscovery procedure will now not use load balancing and
    query routers in a known order (which is randomized by the database).

commit 1325ff893b0bbc20f8a0de6c9dd9bd15124cd0d9
Merge: 89c842fb b88ccaf1

commit 89c842fb83de311ccb65f6991649d65ce1b1099c
Merge: 22ad7458 1a8907bb
Author: Konstantin Lutovich <konstantin.lutovich@neotechnology.com>
Date:   Wed Jun 21 18:01:22 2017 +0200

    Merge pull request #381 from ali-ince/1.4-char-should-encoded-as-string
    
    char values should be encoded as strings

commit b88ccaf1cb7f2ebea22e52a2e8a7e16e9a338b13
Author: lutovich <konstantin.lutovich@neotechnology.com>
Date:   Wed Jun 21 17:19:53 2017 +0200

    Do not cache resolved inet address
    
    Internally driver always uses `BoltServerAddress` to represent host
    and port. These addresses are constructed from the initial driver
    URI and from routing procedure output in routing driver. Bolt address
    is only resolved to an `InetAddress` when new connection is established.
    
    Resolved `InetSocketAddress` was cached in `BoltServerAddress` which
    caused problems when corresponding DNS record changed. Driver would
    then still try to connect to a cached stale `InetSocketAddress`.
    
    This commit makes resolution happen on every connection.

driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/net/BoltServerAddress.java
driver/src/test/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/net/BoltServerAddressTest.java

commit f186165f80ec0dfba3b209b3b7556f0e649924db
Author: lutovich <konstantin.lutovich@neotechnology.com>
Date:   Mon May 22 15:56:43 2017 +0200

    Multiple bookmarks
    
    Previously it was possible to only supply a single bookmark when creating
    a new session. However there is a use-case to be able to supply multiple
    bookmarks when multiple worker threads execute write queries and then
    reader should be able to observe all those writes. To achieve this driver
    now exposed session creation methods that take an iterable of bookmarks.
    
    It was chosen to add additional `Driver#session()` overloads with
    `Iterable<String>` instead of extending single-bookmark methods with
    varargs because:
     * this maintains backwards compatibility for pre-existing methods
     * addition of varargs would make API look strange because call or
       `Driver#session()` and call of `Driver#session(String... bookmarks)`
       without params is essentially the same thing
     * invocation of vararg methods with single `null` argument can be confusing
     * varargs are more suitable for manual params listing
    
    Driver will now send:
    ```
    {
        bookmark: "max",
        bookmarks: ["one", "two", "max"]
    }
    ```
    instead of simple:
    ```
    {
        bookmark: "max"
    }
    ```
    this is done to maintain backwards compatibility with databases that
    only support single bookmark. It forces driver to parse and compare
    bookmarks which violates the fact that bookmarks are opaque. This is
    done only to maintain backwards compatibility and should not be copied.
    Code doing this will eventually be removed.

driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/Bookmark.java
driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/BookmarkCollector.java
driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/ExplicitTransaction.java

commit ddc8cc528db83859fc13deb26bfa150dad01e1b7
Author: lutovich <konstantin.lutovich@neotechnology.com>
Date:   Mon May 22 23:57:52 2017 +0200

    Guard IPv6 test with an assumption
    
    Commit adds a database version assertion to IPv6 direct driver test.
    It is needed because only 3.1+ neo4j versions support
    "dbms.connectors.default_listen_address" configuration option which
    we need to set to "::" for this test. Test got broken when direct
    driver started to verify connectivity on creation. Previously it
    simply accepted IPv6 address but did not try to connect.

driver/src/test/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/DirectDriverTest.java

commit de1faa6b8fc738e8e6fb644c3dbb48dcba7b45d9
Author: lutovich <konstantin.lutovich@neotechnology.com>
Date:   Thu May 18 23:40:01 2017 +0200

    Fix `Transaction#isOpen()` after errors
    
    `ExplicitTransaction` has a FAILED state which is reached when fatal
    connection error happens or `Session#reset()` is called. In both
    cases corresponding transaction on server will be rolled back by the
    database. This commit makes sure FAILED state is changed to ROLLED_BACK
    when transaction is closed. It's needed to make sure
    `Transaction#isOpen()` does not report status incorrectly after
    closing of a FAILED transaction.

driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/ExplicitTransaction.java
driver/src/test/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/ExplicitTransactionTest.java
driver/src/test/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/NetworkSessionTest.java

Author: lutovich <konstantin.lutovich@neotechnology.com>
Date:   Thu May 18 15:59:03 2017 +0200

    Fix `Transaction#isOpen()`
    
    It was previously reporting transactions marked for success/failure as
    closed which is not correct. Transaction will now be considered closed
    only after `Transaction#close()` call which executes commit/rollback.

driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/ExplicitTransaction.java

commit a81b2389b96b2af5ebe6629d0209ff9f672e4352
Author: lutovich <konstantin.lutovich@neotechnology.com>
Date:   Thu May 18 12:26:57 2017 +0200

    Fail early on auth errors in direct driver
    
    This commit makes direct driver test connectivity on creation. It's
    done by opening and closing a connection. Previously driver did not
    try to connect during creation and auth errors (incorrect credentials,
    etc.) popped up only when first query was executed or first
    transaction was started. Such delayed errors were confusing. Also routing
    driver behaved differently because it fetches routing table at creation
    and auth errors come out of constructor.

commit ce414d3b26269be1d927de65e62d27bb2c2b826e
Author: Zhen <zhen.li@neotechnology.com>
Date:   Tue May 16 15:12:34 2017 +0200

    Remove the two-direction reference between connection and packing protocol.
    
    Background:
    A connection holds a socketClient. A socketClient has a protocol which specifies what protocol version the driver should work on.
    When a connection is created in a pool, the connection will first be `started` (where the socketClient will negotiate protocol version with the server) and then `initialized` (where the server version will be sent back).
    
    Problem description:
    The problem that we need to solve here is that for 3.2+ servers, the protocol the driver is working on should allow bytes, while for server version lower than 3.2.0, the protocol should disallow bytes to be sent to prevent from crashing server connection in a bad way. While the server version is only known after the protocol is created, so after the server version arrived the protocol need either be updated (this commit) or the protocol need to be informed (previous impl).
    
    Solution:
    This commit changed the behaviour in connection to update protocol regarding bytes support right after server version is received. By doing in this way we avoid some two-direction reference between connection and protocol.

Date:   Sat Apr 29 22:33:48 2017 +0200

    Added Clirr Maven Plugin to verify backwards compatibility
    
    This plugin compares sources in `org.neo4j.driver.v1` package for
    backwards compatibility against previous (currently 1.2.0) driver
    version. Configuration currently permits adding new interface methods.
    Plugin reads exclusions from `clirr-ignored-differences.xml` file.
    It binds to `compile` Maven phase to perform verification.

commit 3f78fe9997ac65c2e554237fc68dffc3c4a0c26f
Merge: 503a3ee6 d663077b
Author: Zhen Li <zhenlineo@users.noreply.github.com>
Date:   Wed Apr 26 12:07:43 2017 +0200

    Merge pull request #362 from lutovich/1.2-fix-log-leak
    
    Fix possible logger leak

commit d663077bfa41567732634c9179a6d397547c5f77
Author: lutovich <konstantin.lutovich@neotechnology.com>
Date:   Tue Apr 25 19:32:40 2017 +0200

    Fix possible logger leak
    
    Various components like session and connection include their identifiers
    in logs for diagnostic purposes. Most did this by creating loggers with
    specialized names. This is a problematic approach because it forces
    logging framework to create many distinct logger objects. JUL keeps
    such loggers as weakly referenced values in a map. This caused
    excessive GC activity and application failures.
    
    This commit introduces a logger able to prepend diagnostics to messages
    and delegate rest of the work. It makes identifiers part of messages.
    Session, connection and other objects that require identification in
    logs now use this logger.
    
    Example log message:
     `2017-04-25 02:36:47,319 [ConnectionQueue] [127.0.0.1] Error disposing connection`

driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/NetworkSession.java
driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/logging/DelegatingLogger.java
driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/net/SocketConnection.java
driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/net/pooling/BlockingPooledConnectionQueue.java
driver/src/test/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/LeakLoggingNetworkSessionTest.java
driver/src/test/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/logging/DelegatingLoggerTest.java
driver/src/test/java/org/neo4j/driver/v1/stress/CausalClusteringStressIT.java

    it and replaces all usages with `Logger#error(String, Throwable)`.

Date:   Thu Apr 20 18:21:41 2017 +0200

    Prohibit empty keys in routing context
    
    This commit makes routing context fail when parsing URIs like
    `bolt+routing://localhost7687/?key1=value1&=value2`. Empty keys
    should not be supported. Previously it would result in
    `{"key1": "value", "": "value2"}` structure.

Merge: b8392d04 0d1e00fe
Author: Zhen Li <zhenlineo@users.noreply.github.com>
Date:   Wed Apr 19 11:28:35 2017 +0200

    Merge pull request #352 from MishaDemianenko/1.3-unmute-tck-tests
    
    Unmute TCK tests for 3.2

commit b8392d04ad57021db8afc069e402450f04b71c23
Merge: c1636345 aa9e9cc1
Author: Zhen Li <zhenlineo@users.noreply.github.com>
Date:   Wed Apr 12 15:30:37 2017 +0200

    Merge pull request #356 from lutovich/1.3-one-router-valid
    
    Treat one router as valid in routing table

commit aa9e9cc1bc812820ee3a53ded0cab2fe62240fc7
Author: lutovich <konstantin.lutovich@neotechnology.com>
Date:   Wed Apr 12 13:58:52 2017 +0200

    Treat one router as valid in routing table
    
    Previously driver considered routing table with single router to be stale
    and had to perform rediscovery before read/write transaction. Requirement
    to have more than 1 router is quite strict and can easily be violated by
    partially unavailable clusters. Additional rediscoveries in such cases
    add more load on the available core server.
    
    This commit makes driver tread routing table with single router as not
    stale, given that other non-staleness requirements are satisfied as well.

driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/cluster/ClusterRoutingTable.java
driver/src/test/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/RoutingDriverBoltKitTest.java
driver/src/test/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/cluster/ClusterRoutingTableTest.java
driver/src/test/resources/discover_one_router.script

commit c1636345ffff0096f64528a7e182f56175f54567
Merge: 4434a0b6 43cb83d5
Author: Zhen Li <zhenlineo@users.noreply.github.com>
Date:   Wed Apr 12 12:11:16 2017 +0200

    Merge pull request #353 from zhenlineo/1.3-kerberos-auth
    
    Simplify kerberos auth token creation

commit 4434a0b688df35ccbc54f57014c54402e9ae210f
Merge: 256d2b6e c0fd4c96
Author: Zhen Li <zhenlineo@users.noreply.github.com>
Date:   Wed Apr 12 11:14:36 2017 +0200

    Merge pull request #355 from lutovich/1.3-read-without-writer
    
    Read in absence of viable writer

commit c0fd4c96f2d098b3d03c00086d5f1568ed945785
Author: lutovich <konstantin.lutovich@neotechnology.com>
Date:   Tue Apr 11 13:37:47 2017 +0200

    Read in absence of viable writer
    
    Previously driver did not allow reads and writes when received routing
    table did not contains both routers, readers and writers. This was
    inconsistent with Causal Cluster which allows reads when leader is absent.
    Leader might be unavailable for a long time (when there is a DC failure, etc.)
    so it makes sense to allow clients to perform read activity.
    
    This commit makes driver accept routing table with no writers and allow
    clients to perform read operations when writers are not available. It
    might be problematic when there is a cluster partition and one partition
    contains majority. For this case special care must be taken so driver
    does not get stuck talking only to the smaller partition which only
    knows about itself. This is done on best effort basis - driver tries
    to contact seed router if previously accepted routing table did not
    contain writes.

commit 559db5af8154311ee6c564ea452ef34f163decb5
Author: lutovich <konstantin.lutovich@neotechnology.com>
Date:   Thu Mar 30 00:25:53 2017 +0200

    Routing context in URI
    
    Routing context is a map of string key-value pairs. It is send to the
    database when calling `dbms.cluster.routing.getRoutingTable` procedure
    as it's single argument. This is only supported by 3.2+ servers.
    
    Previously routing context was defined on the config. It is problematic
    because routing context in `bolt+routing` specific and thus makes no
    sense for single instance database.
    
    This commit makes routing context part of the `bolt+routing` URI. It
    lives in the query part of the URI as regular query parameters like:
    `bolt+routing://localhost:7687/?policy=my_policy&region=china`.
    Clustering-specific configuration method is removed.

driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/DriverFactory.java
driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/cluster/LoadBalancer.java
driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/cluster/Rediscovery.java
driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/cluster/RoutingContext.java
driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/cluster/RoutingProcedureClusterCompositionProvider.java
driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/cluster/RoutingProcedureRunner.java

driver/src/test/java/org/neo4j/driver/v1/EventLogger.java

commit 55d0df3448af0190ebd79e8510e63c0a25eb796c
Author: lutovich <konstantin.lutovich@neotechnology.com>
Date:   Mon Mar 27 14:33:59 2017 +0200

    Simplify retry logic
    
    It was previously represented with two interfaces - `RetryLogic` and
    `RetryDecision`. First containing the actual code to decide if retry
    should happen and second holding the state between retries. Approach
    works but it is unnecessarily complex.
    
    This commit simplifies rety logic to a single interface `RetryLogic`
    with a single method that takes a function to execute and performs
    all needed retries.

commit 78160aefef3e6fd1d06a73fb45948db806531ace
Author: lutovich <konstantin.lutovich@neotechnology.com>
Date:   Fri Mar 24 14:50:01 2017 +0100

    Deprecated old routing retry settings
    
    This commit deprecates `ConfigBuilder#withRoutingFailureLimit()` and
    `ConfigBuilder#withRoutingRetryDelay()` methods because they are now obsolete.
    They were initially introduced to postpone failure when no routers are
    available. Currently there exists a better way of doing this with transaction
    functions (`Session#readTransaction()` and `Session@writeTransaction()`).
    Driver also memorizes the seed URI and falls back to it during rediscovery
    when all other routers are dead.

driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/v1/Config.java

Merge: bec13b3a b40e53a4
Author: Zhen Li <zhen.li@neotechnology.com>

    Merge pull request #340 from lutovich/1.2-reset-tx-func
    
    Fix reset of transaction functions

commit b40e53a452d561c0fba0b7426e58b2c1fa65b241
Author: lutovich <konstantin.lutovich@neotechnology.com>
Date:   Wed Mar 22 17:01:53 2017 +0100

    Fix reset of transaction functions
    
    Transaction functions (`Session#readTransaction()` and
    `Session#writeTransaction()`) should respect `Session#reset()` call the
    same way other statement running operations do. They shouldn't continue
    retrying after `#reset()`.
    
    This commit makes transaction functions responsive to reset by removing
    excessive synchronization and adding status code checks so retries do not
    happen when transaction is explicitly terminated.

Author: lutovich <konstantin.lutovich@neotechnology.com>
Date:   Thu Mar 9 12:13:31 2017 +0100

    Guard couple tests with assumption about bookmark support
    
    Some newly added tests check bookmark to assert that read transaction was
    committed. They failed when using Neo4j version earlier than 3.1.0 because
    those are not bookmark-aware. This commit guards such tests with JUnit
    assumption about bookmark support based on server version.

commit 17755a330486a7768710feaa7330fc7cd00439b8
Author: lutovich <konstantin.lutovich@neotechnology.com>
Date:   Wed Mar 8 11:19:10 2017 +0100

    Internalised marking for success in readTx & writeTx
    
    This commit makes `Session#readTransaction()` and `Session#writeTransaction()`
    automatically commit when transaction was not marked as failure and no
    exception was thrown. This effectively removes the need to call `tx.success()`
    as the last statement in a transaction.

commit 0035520d81d321cd21e393978b273efbfd8bfd9c
Author: lutovich <konstantin.lutovich@neotechnology.com>
Date:   Wed Mar 8 00:44:18 2017 +0100

    Dedicated functional interface for readTx and writeTx
    
    Added dedicated functional interface `TransactionWork` to be used in
    `Session#readTransaction()` and `Session#writeTransaction()` methods.
    It does not change how code looks for Java 8 lambdas but looks better with
    Java 7 where users do not need to implement `Function<T,U>` where first
    generic type parameter is always `Transaction`.

driver/src/test/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/NetworkSessionTest.java

commit fd1a1adf3621b08add86a0f9913e65eb1e028400
Author: lutovich <konstantin.lutovich@neotechnology.com>
Date:   Tue Feb 28 19:32:51 2017 +0100

    Retry with exponential backoff
    
    This commit changes default retry policy from fixed backoff to exponential
    backoff with random jitter. Retry policy is user when retrying transactions
    executed via `Session#readTransaction()` and `Session#writeTransaction()`
    methods. Exponential backoff with random jitter is a better policy because
    it spreads out clusters of retries and progressively reduces load on
    the database.
    
    The only configuration option available is:
    `ConfigBuilder#withMaxTransactionRetryTime()`
    which sets a cap on how long particular transaction can be retried with
    exponential backoff.

commit de1b84c02f30c541e966e2c79ca3064a281024ba
Author: lutovich <konstantin.lutovich@neotechnology.com>
Date:   Tue Feb 28 00:08:15 2017 +0100

    Clear interrupted status of a thread in test
    
    `RetryWithDelayTest#throwsWhenSleepInterrupted()` test mocks throwing of
    `InterruptedException` and triggers handling code to restore the interrupted
    status. This caused some subsequent tests to fail because they still saw
    current thread as being interrupted.
    
    This commit adds clearing of the interrupted status to the test.

driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/cluster/LoadBalancer.java

commit 9776f6e5e77af8e9a3b31349bccb967704fdd233
Author: lutovich <konstantin.lutovich@neotechnology.com>
Date:   Mon Feb 27 18:45:15 2017 +0100

    Preserve ordering of servers in routing table
    
    This commit makes routing table use same ordering of read, write and route
    servers as returned by the `getServers()` procedure call. Database uses lists
    to represent these servers and randomly shuffles them before returning, so
    it makes sense using the provided randomized view. Is also makes boltkit
    tests more predictable and easy to reason about.

commit 40df5dfe7aa90beec00527133f9c4c0cbd30dbea
Author: lutovich <konstantin.lutovich@neotechnology.com>
Date:   Mon Feb 27 17:28:38 2017 +0100

    Configurable retries for declarative transactions
    
    Added ability to retry transactions executed via `Session#readTransaction()`
    and `Session#writeTransaction()` methods. Given unit of work will be retried
    configured number of times with configured delay if it experiences
    `ServiceUnavailableException` or `SessionExpiredException`. This means it'll
    be retried when a network error happens of cluster member becomes unavailable.

commit 927b6b590dfc8ef6c740793e5ef977783781610e
Author: lutovich <konstantin.lutovich@neotechnology.com>
Date:   Sat Feb 25 12:49:01 2017 +0100

    Added declarative transaction methods to session
    
    Commit adds two new methods to the `Session` interface to allow
    declarative transactions:
     * `#readTransaction(Function<Transaction, T> work)`
     * `#writeTransaction(Function<Transaction, T> work)`
    
    These methods currently only hide transaction creation and closing. They
    return whatever the given function returns. Main reason for adding them is
    that later we can hide retries behind such declarative api, which is
    especially useful for "bolt+routing" driver which talks to a causal cluster.

driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/NetworkSession.java

commit bb2ea6c360ed596a6ceedd6891247bc29ecf3540
Author: lutovich <konstantin.lutovich@neotechnology.com>
Date:   Sat Feb 25 11:16:06 2017 +0100

    Deprecated `Session#beginTransaction(String bookmark)`
    
    In favour of `Driver#session(String bookmark)`. This is made to bring symmetry
    with regards to `Session#lastBookmark()` and emphasize that bookmark is a
    session level concept.

commit 75abc846e3002255ceb7c0e1dec6fa19098ef2bf
Author: lutovich <konstantin.lutovich@neotechnology.com>
Date:   Sat Feb 25 10:43:18 2017 +0100

    Allow bookmark in `Driver#session()`
    
    This commit adds new API methods to create session with the specified bookmark.
    This means first transaction will ensure that the server, it is connected to,
    is at least up to the database version denoted by the bookmark.
    
    Following new methods are introduced in the `Driver` interface:
     * `#session(String bookmark)`
     * `#session(AccessMode mode, String bookmark)`
    
    Bookmark is a session related concept and this commit adds symmetry with
    regards to `Session#lastBookmark()` method.

driver/src/test/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/InternalStatementResultTest.java

commit 520c65d50f402dd57c39673da11d539f641f7a12
Author: lutovich <konstantin.lutovich@neotechnology.com>
Date:   Thu Feb 23 22:46:04 2017 +0100

    Close connection after result reading failure
    
    When result fetching fails (cypher runtime error or network error) exception
    is thrown but it is still possible to maintain a reference to the result
    object. It'll just be empty after failure. It is not possible to fetch any
    other records after failure and the underlying pooled connection can be
    closed and returned to the pool.
    
    This commit makes result return its connection to the pool on failure. This
    connection (if healthy) can be used by subsequent sessions. Also added tests
    for connection handling.

driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/InternalStatementResult.java
driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/NetworkSession.java
driver/src/test/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/InternalStatementResultTest.java
driver/src/test/java/org/neo4j/driver/v1/ConnectionHandlingIT.java

Date:   Thu Feb 23 13:57:06 2017 +0100

    Removed DriverClosedException
    
    All usages changed back to IllegalStateException. This revert is done because
    we should first refine driver errors hierarchy and only then introduce
    specific exception types.

commit d68e8918d6bbf21bf30885172a2be5f0da647285
Author: lutovich <konstantin.lutovich@neotechnology.com>
Date:   Wed Feb 22 22:31:59 2017 +0100

    Decouple session from connection
    
    Previously session was bound to a connection and used this same connection
    throughout its lifetime. This means that there was no load-balancing within
    single session and that connection could have been claimed by the session
    for a long time without actually being used.
    
    This commit makes session obtain new connections when needed and return them
    to the pool as soon as possible. New connection is obtained for:
     * each `Session#run()`
     * each `Session#beginTransaction()` and created transaction holds same
     connection throughout its lifetime
    Connection is returned back to the pool when either:
     * result is fully read into memory
     * transaction is closed
     * subsequent `Session#run()` is invoked
    
    Introduced new interface `ConnectionHandler` to manage connections around
    session, result and transaction. `NetworkSession` is the only implementation
    of this interface.
    Also added new `DriverClosedException` thrown on every interaction with a
    closed driver.

driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/ConnectionHandler.java
driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/DirectConnectionProvider.java

commit f5249bbac2f8b235d51b37575aa6dab1d60740c3
Author: lutovich <konstantin.lutovich@neotechnology.com>
Date:   Tue Feb 21 16:49:48 2017 +0100

    Simplify driver implementations
    
    Previously there existed two driver implementations `DirectDriver` and
    `RoutingDriver`. Main difference was that first one used connection pool
    directly while the second one used load balancing connection pool.
    
    This commit introduces an interface to unify connection pool and load balancer
    and collapses two driver implementations into one that uses this interface.
    This also makes it more convenient to decouple connection from session because
    session can now use this same single interface without knowing if it is a
    direct or routing session.

commit b8d193328c311ab17f1c31bfffd6fe86257fb5cc
Author: lutovich <konstantin.lutovich@neotechnology.com>
Date:   Tue Feb 21 12:09:03 2017 +0100

    Move couple methods from Connection to PooledConnection
    
    Methods `#onError()` and `#hasUnrecoverableErrors()` are only useful in pooled
    connection and their implementations threw exceptions in regular connection.
    This commit moves them to `PooledConnection` interface.

commit 2d694ffc9e084785f62968e6fde3981a855b42d5
Author: lutovich <konstantin.lutovich@neotechnology.com>
Date:   Mon Feb 20 23:13:23 2017 +0100

    Move error handling logic to the connection layer
    
    It was previously spread between `RoutingSession`, `RoutingTransaction` and
    `RoutingStatementResult` and they all did the same thing when connection
    errors happened.
    
    This commit introduces `RoutingPooledConnection` that handles errors for
    routing driver by removing entries from the routing table and purging
    connection pool for failed address.

commit 27cdf2b7fd1cbb7b1c06c40053d6b1b5a78885f1
Author: Nikolajs Arhipovs <nikolajs.arhipovs@gmail.com>
Date:   Mon Feb 6 11:44:44 2017 +0200

    Added --allow-script-in-comments to javadoc config
    
    Since Java 8u121, JavaScript is disabled in JavaDoc's by default (http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/8u121-relnotes-3315208.html), failing build. To fix this JavaScript should be enabled explicitly with a flag --allow-script-in-comments.

commit d2950c611cfd8e8f9cb9d71351a83fdcd0582518
Author: lutovich <konstantin.lutovich@neotechnology.com>
Date:   Wed Jan 18 23:05:51 2017 +0100

    Add basic causal clustering stress test
    
    This commit introduces a basic stress test for `bolt+routing` scheme with the
    following commands:
     * read query using `Session#run()`
     * read query using `Transaction#run()`
     * write query using `Session#run()`
     * write query using `Transaction#run()`
     * write query through read session using `Session#run()`
     * write query through read session using `Transaction#run()`
     * create new driver using wrong credentials
    
    Test can run either against a local cluster (started with boltkit) or against
    a remote cluster if the needed system property is set. Duration and thread
    count can also be configured through system properties. Number of open
    file descriptors is asserted to not be very high after the load is applied.
    
    Also made some cleanup around dev null logging.

commit 3ca3290ed0d66db54b6a988163755415b7e018cd
Merge: e24d07d3 f6222c7d
Author: Zhen Li <zhen.li@neotechnology.com>
Date:   Thu Jan 5 16:51:19 2017 +0100

    Merge pull request #303 from neo4j/1.1-block-for-bookmark
    
    Wait for bookmark when starting a transaction

commit f6222c7d3d0b4c72734a750e37cc88fc0cf6b73b
Author: lutovich <konstantin.lutovich@neotechnology.com>
Date:   Wed Jan 4 23:38:45 2017 +0100

    Wait for bookmark when starting a transaction
    
    It is possible to specify bookmark when starting a transaction. First `BEGIN`
    statement would then contain the given bookmark in params. Database will wait
    when processing such `BEGIN` for the state described by the bookmark to appear.
    
    Sending `BEGIN` and bookmark was previously lazy. So it was possible to start
    a transaction with an invalid/unreachable bookmark. Error would in such case
    pop up only after the next sync (commit or consume) which is too late and can
    be quite confusing.
    
    This commit makes transaction eagerly send `BEGIN` and `PULL_ALL` messages
    when non-null bookmark is given. It makes `session#beginTransaction("bookmark")`
    call blocking but the API less surprising.

driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/ExplicitTransaction.java
driver/src/test/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/ExplicitTransactionTest.java
driver/src/test/java/org/neo4j/driver/v1/integration/BookmarkIT.java
driver/src/test/java/org/neo4j/driver/v1/integration/CausalClusteringIT.java

commit fb365d8fad28559848b3148e2eb42d35aedbaab2
Author: lutovich <konstantin.lutovich@neotechnology.com>
Date:   Mon Jan 2 14:53:37 2017 +0100

    Retry until connection is created
    
    `SocketConnectionPool` can test connections during acquisition. This is done
    when they have been idle in the pool for too long. This commit makes it retry
    until new connection is created instead of `maxPoolSize`times.

commit e2082b523262ea1430c3866586a41ab28cb8306b
Author: lutovich <konstantin.lutovich@neotechnology.com>
Date:   Fri Dec 23 23:43:25 2016 +0100

    Configurable test-on-borrow for pooled connections
    
    Connections are pooled for both direct and routing driver. Each acquired
    session contains a socket connection which was acquired from the pool.
    It is possible for an idle pooled connection to become invalid while just
    resting in the pool. This could happen when connection is terminated after
    some timeout by a load balancer or some other network facility.
    
    This commit introduces a configurable connection liveness check timeout.
    So freshly acquired connection, that has been idle in the pool for more
    than configurable timeout, will be validated by sending a RESET message.
    If it appears to be broken acquisition will retry until a valid
    connection is found.

driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/net/pooling/PoolSettings.java

Date:   Tue Dec 13 14:50:50 2016 +0100

    Make socket connection timeout configurable
    
    Previously socket connect did not have a timeout and was bounded only by the
    timeout configured on the OS level. Such timeout could be rather long and
    result in repeated stalls trying to refresh routing table against a failed
    router.

    300ms delay.

commit 78f65ae29b4de0b202ed4f71b4bc3568cd630ccc
Author: lutovich <konstantin.lutovich@neotechnology.com>
Date:   Tue Dec 13 17:33:59 2016 +0100

    Remove terminated connection queues from the pool
    
    It was previously possible for empty/terminated connection queues to stay in
    the `SocketConnectionPool` when is was closed concurrently with sessions being
    acquired. This was not critical because `SocketConnectionPool` is only closed
    when the whole driver is closed but resulted in a flaky test.
    
    This commit adds removal of terminated connection queues.

driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/net/pooling/SocketConnectionPool.java
driver/src/test/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/net/pooling/SocketConnectionPoolTest.java

    Previously test had no assertions. This commit makes it assert that all
    workers terminated successfully.

driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/DriverFactory.java

commit 5a4c9e215f736fd3c5f3050a1e2d3e18f97f783d
Author: lutovich <konstantin.lutovich@neotechnology.com>
Date:   Wed Nov 30 23:03:27 2016 +0000

    Removed finalize from NetworkSession
    
    It contained logic for closing opened underlying connection and logging info
    about the leak. Closing of resources in finalize is not reliable and overridden
    finalize can hurt when many sessions are garbage collected.
    
    Commit also introduces a system property `org.neo4j.driver.logSessionLeaks`
    to enable logging of unclosed/leaked sessions and log stacktrace of where they
    were instantiated. This is meant to help with session leak investigations. So
    finalization overhead will be present only when problem is present and is
    being investigated.

driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/BaseDriver.java
driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/DirectDriver.java
driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/DriverFactory.java
driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/LeakLoggingNetworkSession.java
driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/LeakLoggingNetworkSessionFactory.java
driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/NetworkSession.java
driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/NetworkSessionFactory.java
driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/RoutingDriver.java

commit e4435e775bd081d4940e604441fc74f071fed317
Merge: cec0652a 668815c4
Author: Zhen Li <zhen.li@neotechnology.com>
Date:   Fri Dec 9 11:54:18 2016 +0100

    Merge pull request #291 from lutovich/1.1-concurrent-driver-stop
    
    Better handling of concurrent driver close

commit 668815c49075349338a4c4c2b5b9049dc50f48ed
Author: lutovich <konstantin.lutovich@neotechnology.com>
Date:   Thu Dec 8 17:05:04 2016 +0100

    Close connection pool if driver creation fails
    
    Connection pool (`SocketConnectionPool`) is created before drivers and was
    never closed if driver creation failed. This was especially possible with
    `RoutingDriver` which tries to build routing table in constructor.
    
    This commit adds closing of the connection pool when creation of driver fails.
    It also extracts driver creation logic into an internal class `DriverFactory`
    to make it testable.

driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/DriverFactory.java
driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/v1/GraphDatabase.java
driver/src/test/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/DriverFactoryTest.java

commit 4b0c5aa995263b82392e883165b2dacc59a9cffd
Author: lutovich <konstantin.lutovich@neotechnology.com>
Date:   Thu Dec 8 14:37:12 2016 +0100

    Close connection if init failed
    
    Init message is send every time we establish a new socket connection. This is
    the very first thing connection does. It is possible for the init to fail
    (for example when credentials are wrong). Previously socket connection was not
    closed after such init failure.
    
    This commit changes `SocketConnector` to close connection on any init failure.

driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/net/SocketConnector.java
driver/src/test/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/net/SocketConnectorTest.java

commit 6f0cf2d31c7ced9992532e0ef4ba83bcd69ec58f
Author: lutovich <konstantin.lutovich@neotechnology.com>
Date:   Thu Dec 8 14:21:33 2016 +0100

    Better handle async close in SocketConnectionPool
    
    This pool can be used from multiple threads. It is possible for `#close()` to
    be called concurrently with `#acquire()`. Previously we did not guard against
    this situation and it was possible to acquire connections from the closed pool.
    It could also happen that `#close()` does not actually close all connection
    queues because iteration over them is not atomic.
    
    This commit makes `SocketConnectionPool` track if it is closed or not. It also
    introduces `Connector` abstraction (which is merely a connection factory) so
    that `SocketConnectionPool` can be easily tested.

driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/net/SocketConnector.java
driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/net/pooling/SocketConnectionPool.java
driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/spi/Connector.java
driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/v1/GraphDatabase.java
driver/src/test/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/net/SocketConnectorTest.java
driver/src/test/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/net/pooling/SocketConnectionPoolTest.java

commit 539b90f0b92cde8440ea706b497ad5db92249836
Author: lutovich <konstantin.lutovich@neotechnology.com>
Date:   Wed Dec 7 14:23:41 2016 +0100

    Better handling of termination failures in connection queue
    
    `BlockingPooledConnectionQueue` disposes both idle and acquired connections
    when it is terminated. It was previously possible for termination process to
    stop halfway if disposal of some connection fails.
    
    This commit makes pool termination try to dispose all connections regardless
    of errors.

driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/net/pooling/BlockingPooledConnectionQueue.java
driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/net/pooling/SocketConnectionPool.java
driver/src/test/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/net/pooling/BlockingPooledConnectionQueueTest.java
driver/src/test/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/net/pooling/PooledConnectionTest.java

commit 6faf667f47f739401d02ea82d2cd8691057be1be
Author: lutovich <konstantin.lutovich@neotechnology.com>
Date:   Wed Dec 7 13:34:17 2016 +0100

    Removed unused SocketUtils class

driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/connector/socket/SocketUtils.java

commit 449ae97e7286404e415067f9c0fab7e3db90e9bc
Author: lutovich <konstantin.lutovich@neotechnology.com>
Date:   Wed Dec 7 13:16:24 2016 +0100

    Allow concurrent close of connections
    
    It is possible for connection to be closed from another thread while it is
    being used to do some work (send/receive data from socket, etc.). This could
    happen when whole driver is closed while there still exist threads doing actual
    work.
    
    Each `SocketConnection` is guarded by `ConcurrencyGuardingConnection`
    that throws if concurrent access is detected. This wrapper guarded `#close()`
    call as well so exceptions could be thrown on `Driver#close()`. Close procedure
    would then not be completed and some connections would not be closed.
    
    This commit allows concurrent close in `ConcurrencyGuardingConnection`.

driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/net/ConcurrencyGuardingConnection.java
driver/src/test/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/net/ConcurrencyGuardingConnectionTest.java

commit a234ca0cac2b12d6f92619b21a26bd2a975b3fc8

    Better handling of cluster startup failures
    
    And couple small cleanups.

commit c3c101dd1227150a538aefb2a236f12b0ef31009
Merge: 37171aef e6c9976a
Author: Lars Martin <lars.martin@smb-tec.com>
Date:   Wed Nov 30 06:55:10 2016 +0100

    Merge branch '1.1' of github.com:neo4j/neo4j-java-driver into osgified
    
    * '1.1' of github.com:neo4j/neo4j-java-driver:
      Fail-fast interactions with closed driver
      Fix the nested tx error A session could be used to run multiple Txs, but each Tx should close before starting another tx in the same session.
      Use explicit instead of auto-commit transactions in examples
      Replaced `$` with `{...}` in parameter syntax for backwards compatibility
      Tidied up the println in the example
      Added explicit transactions to the example
      Implemented `try-with-resources` in example
      Added params to queries; stylistic fixes
      `myserver` -> `localhost` in examples
      Changed `localhost` -> `myserver:7687` in examples

commit e6c9976abb02789adabf6412d73550ad6cc5ed88
Merge: 32b1c821 bc3fe066
Author: Zhen Li <zhen.li@neotechnology.com>
Date:   Tue Nov 29 19:12:19 2016 +0100

    Merge pull request #283 from lutovich/1.1-closed-driver
    
    Better handling of closed driver

commit bc3fe0662d90dcf9fa7be3ff7d91a2f8a3352605
Author: lutovich <konstantin.lutovich@neotechnology.com>
Date:   Tue Nov 29 12:28:46 2016 +0000

    Fail-fast interactions with closed driver
    
    It was previously possible to use closed driver instance, obtain sessions from
    it and run queries. This was seen to cause problems in multi-threaded scenarios
    when some worker threads try to use driver, which was concurrently closed by
    other worker.
    
    This commit makes driver track if it is closed or not and throw exceptions if
    on every interaction when closed. Thrown exception is `IllegalStateException`.
    Actuall `#close()` method can be called multiple times and is a no-op for
    already closed driver.

driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/BaseDriver.java
driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/DirectDriver.java
driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/RoutingDriver.java
driver/src/test/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/net/pooling/PooledConnectionTest.java
driver/src/test/java/org/neo4j/driver/v1/DriverCloseIT.java

commit 32b1c821a807bfd09e1d63b1108d7a89bd5ca26d

commit f8b5d568af2cf1521e241a0378538cb74b911c94
Author: Zhen <zhen.li@neotechnology.com>
Date:   Tue Nov 29 11:56:44 2016 +0100

    Fix the nested tx error
    A session could be used to run multiple Txs, but each Tx should close before starting another tx in the same session.

driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/net/pooling/PoolSettings.java
driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/v1/Config.java
driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/v1/GraphDatabase.java

commit db739e9328fbbaa78ddaeff040ea7b9be9d4cedc
Author: lutovich <konstantin.lutovich@neotechnology.com>
Date:   Fri Nov 25 12:17:32 2016 +0100

    Remove ping on Session#close()
    
    Previously ping query (`RETURN 1`) was executed on each `Session#close()`.
    This was intended to verify the underlying connection and decide if it should
    be returned to the pool or not.
    
    Running such ping is not quite necessary because we already execute `RESET` and
    `SYNC` before that. Combination of `RESET` and `SYNC` guarantees to send at
    least one message and thus validates the connection. Also query `RETURN 1`
    made database start transaction and possibly do planning, this work seem
    unnecessary.
    
    This commit removes ping and adds tests to verify that we actually send
    messages to socket during pooled connection validation.

driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/net/SocketConnection.java
driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/net/pooling/PooledConnectionValidator.java
driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/net/pooling/SocketConnectionPool.java
driver/src/test/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/net/SocketConnectionTest.java
driver/src/test/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/net/pooling/ConnectionInvalidationTest.java
driver/src/test/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/net/pooling/PooledConnectionValidatorTest.java
driver/src/test/resources/acquire_endpoints.script
driver/src/test/resources/dead_server.script
driver/src/test/resources/discover_servers.script
driver/src/test/resources/failed_discovery.script

driver/src/test/resources/not_able_to_write_server.script

driver/src/test/resources/write_server.script

commit 9dcbbf91d6d8d5c15b609259e635db9bb5017c50
Merge: 0b2b4b28 28a3c3f7
Author: Pontus Melke <pontusmelke@gmail.com>
Date:   Wed Oct 26 11:08:02 2016 +0200

    Merge pull request #259 from thobe/1.1-routing-refactor
    
    Refactor routing logic to better handle failures

commit 28a3c3f7b14a140e85c75d0bde5603531fd56495
Author: Tobias Lindaaker <tobias@thobe.org>
Date:   Mon Oct 24 13:38:20 2016 +0200

    Refactor routing logic to better handle failures
    
    Separate out different parts of the logic into different classes:
     * When to update the view of the cluster, and the maintenance of the
       set of servers in the cluster:
       - LoadBalancer
     * The ability to retrieve a list of servers with roles
       (ClusterComposition) from a server:
       - ClusterComposition.Provider
     * Round Robin cycling through a set of addresses (maintaining the
       order/position on addition/removal of members in the set):
      - RoundRobinAddressSet
    
    The new logic distinguishes being unable to connect to the routing
    servers and maintains the server in the list in this case, under the
    assumption that the server is only temporarily unavailable. The
    attempt to contact routing servers only fail after a number of failed
    attempts with an exponential back off in between.
    
    These changes introduce event based testing for some of the components,
    this makes it easier to test for the behaviour of units, rather than
    asserting on their state, while the explicitness of it makes it easier
    to follow than using mocks.

commit 8cfe635ffb19757753a85b2aa6ad9d24fbb9223c
Author: Pontus Melke <pontusmelke@gmail.com>
Date:   Wed Oct 19 09:03:14 2016 +0200

    Close all connections on driver.close()
    
    Connections/Sessions that were in flight, i.e. acquired from the pool, were not
    closed when shutting down the driver, connections remained open until GC
    happened. The expected behavior is that `driver.close()` closes down all
    sessions it has created.

commit 14be5b3bd73b08cd16b5d1be7746b2311bb62113
Author: Pontus Melke <pontusmelke@gmail.com>
Date:   Thu Oct 13 08:49:24 2016 +0200

    Should throw `SessionExpired` instead of `ConnectionFailure`
    
    Whenever we run out of read or write servers the situation may still fix itself
    on the next routing call so we should throw `SessionExpiredException` to indicate
    to the user session acquisition should be retried.

commit 3004db09704e14d437d1d5cc8ecd195051e604fe
Author: Pontus Melke <pontusmelke@gmail.com>
Date:   Thu Oct 6 18:05:45 2016 +0200

    Make sure connection is only called once.
    
    Instead of guarding in `PooledConnection` as well as in `NetworkSession` we
    make sure we only close connection once in `RoutingDriver`

commit cdc79cad3ff3c02c4956f0b6a73ca6a6e056c6cc
Author: Pontus Melke <pontusmelke@gmail.com>
Date:   Thu Oct 6 16:52:41 2016 +0200

    Don't add the same connection multiple times
    
    The same connections was being added to the queue if close was called more
    than once. Eventually the queue will be full and we close the connection, but
    since the queue now contains multiple identical copies we will also close these.

commit 9db607612e897062b52528413cd64dcf619245e8
Author: Pontus Melke <pontusmelke@gmail.com>
Date:   Wed Oct 5 12:44:31 2016 +0200

    Remove server when failing on session acquisition
    
    We were only checking for connection failures on running and consuming the
    results, however there might also be a connection failure on session acquisition.
    By not properly removing the server on session-acquisition failures we end up
    in a scenario where we constantly retry to connect to that endpoint.

Merge: 9263030f ccd28430

commit 51248ce01dd3eefa2819c9b902380cc2c52e1c32
Author: Zhen <zhen.li@neotechnology.com>
Date:   Thu Sep 22 12:29:48 2016 +0200

    Muted ack_failure while a reset is sent and no reply has been recived
    
    Given the following message senquence between server and client
    
    C           S
    RUN      -> FAIL, error e
    PULL_ALL -> IGNORED
    RESET    -> SUCC
    
    In the previous PR, the error e could be thrown either after RESET or before RESET depending on if we called sync (receiveAll) after RESET or before RESET.
    In this PR, by replacing receiveAll with receiveOne multiple times, we ensure that if the sesssion get interrupted, the error e is always immediately thrown before reset. Therefore we know we could mute akc_failure after a reset is sent, before a reply to this reset is received.

driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/ClusterDriver.java

commit e9d44ff7be23f17a5d2caa780250be9f521947a8
Author: Pontus Melke <pontusmelke@gmail.com>
Date:   Thu Sep 22 14:14:52 2016 +0200

    Properly close "forgotten connections"
    
    Whenever we do rediscovery and the server forces us to discard all connections to
    endpoints no longer valid in the servers point-of-view, there is a chance there are
    still open connections to those endpoints and when closing these open sessions we
    must make sure we properly close these connections without putting them back to the
    connection pool.

    Rediscovery no longer additive
    
    Whenever we go down to the database to call `getServers` we should use the
    values returned from the call and forget about any servers returned in previous
    calls.

    `ttl` that is no longer per server but a global `ttl` for the returned servers.

commit dba1165cbbed7e89a0cf3a53d41e0d414e436e4e
Author: Pontus Melke <pontusmelke@gmail.com>
Date:   Tue Sep 20 14:39:48 2016 +0200

    Automatically close on session.reset()
    
    In the event of a reset the transaction should be completely closed and the
    session should be ready to create new transactions without explicitly closing
    any transactions.

commit e30e01e11efea537a733c3843023de8b410e8720
Author: Pontus Melke <pontusmelke@gmail.com>
Date:   Tue Sep 13 17:14:19 2016 +0200

    Remove retry handling for read sessions
    
    The plan of automatically handle retries on read sessions didn't really pan
    out since we don't really control when data is transported over the network
    and errors are noticed. Instead we treat reads and writes in the same way, i.e.
    throwing a `SessionExpiredException` on all connection failures.

    a more specific, `ConnectionFailureException` so that the driver could better
    recover from failures.

commit 2af94d038b9e12ec9c699335c2330e9c6e9e4833
Author: Zhen <zhen.li@neotechnology.com>
Date:   Mon Aug 8 17:20:52 2016 +0200

    Make sessioin.reset thread-safe
    Sync on `enqueue` and `flush` to avoid sending `reset` and other messages at the same time.
    Also changed response handler stream collector queue to be concurrent queue so that adding into the queue (sending) and removing from the queue (receiving) can be done safely concurrently.
    Keep `ack_fail` muted when `reset` is already send but not replied yet.

driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/NetworkSession.java
driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/net/SocketConnection.java
driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/net/SocketResponseHandler.java

commit cf3dd8fceb30485877d6400968d42859e50192dd
Author: Pontus Melke <pontusmelke@gmail.com>
Date:   Thu Aug 25 15:20:08 2016 +0200

    Deprecate TRUST_SIGNED_CERTIFICATES
    
    `TRUST_SIGNED_CERTIFICATES` is behaving differently on different platforms. In
    order to clean this up we deprecate it and replace with
    
    - `TRUST_SYSTEM_CA_SIGNED_CERTIFICATES` which trusts the system defaults on the
    platform
    
    - `TRUST_CUSTOM_CA_SIGNED_CERTIFICATES` which trusts a particular root
    certificate (can be a self-signed certificate for example)

driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/connector/socket/SSLContextFactory.java
driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/v1/Config.java
driver/src/test/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/ConfigTest.java
driver/src/test/java/org/neo4j/driver/v1/integration/TLSSocketChannelIT.java
driver/src/test/java/org/neo4j/driver/v1/tck/DriverSecurityComplianceSteps.java
examples/src/main/java/org/neo4j/docs/driver/Examples.java

commit 5ea1e698c878b2b683c210675ad27ba6dc5cf492
Author: Zhen <zhen.li@neotechnology.com>
Date:   Mon Jul 18 16:28:12 2016 +0200

    Mark a few [client message, server response messages] pairs as invalid message response pairs,
    these message pairs are listed as follows:
    
    INIT        <- IGNORED
    ACK_FAILURE <- IGNORED
    ACK_FAILURE <- FAILURE
    RESET       <- IGNORED
    RESET       <- FAILURE
    
    In case of seeing such message pairs, raise an unrecoverable error message on client side.

commit 1d734a47886a48dabe0a902edccc9be62e8acda4
Author: Zhen <zhen.li@neotechnology.com>
Date:   Thu Jul 14 17:28:26 2016 +0200

    Fix the problem where the tx cannot run after ack_failure
    The reason of the test failure was that the roll_back is not sent to the server to terminate current tx.
    So the next run will just inject into previous tx.

commit 4314207381fda86ce0839209c159842d960e3206
Author: Zhen <zhen.li@neotechnology.com>
Date:   Fri Jun 17 20:05:06 2016 +0200

    Improved return to pool to be thread-safe
    
    Fixed the bug where the connection is not return to pool or closed when it is invalid
    Fixed the bug where the connection is disposed but being put back to pool
    Fixed a race condition where the connection is put back to pool after the pool is cleared
    Added more tests to make sure that all state changes of a pooled connection related to pooling and disposing are thread-safe

commit 8d008557084b8e80b5a0872ff366b794590803dd

commit 429e7f542a0732a0a4c7b5e43273e85d847e3576
Author: Pontus Melke <pontusmelke@gmail.com>
Date:   Fri May 27 15:08:40 2016 +0200

    Don't add everything back to live queue
    
    Previously whenever an object was picked off the thread local cache it was
    added back to the live queue even thought it was never removed from there.
    This lead to indefinite growth of the live queue.

driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/pool/ThreadCachingPool.java
driver/src/test/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/pool/ThreadCachingPoolTest.java

commit db402b2e42e1a4da8e41fabcb6829f777ca7da3b
Author: Nigel Small <nigel.small@neotechnology.com>
Date:   Fri May 27 10:30:43 2016 +0100

    Added contrib guide

CONTRIBUTING.md

commit 246ebaab624bab920000bfe3a75d9406ac98d01f
Author: Pontus Melke <pontusmelke@gmail.com>
Date:   Thu May 26 09:34:10 2016 +0200

    Avoid marking objects as both live and disposed
    
    In the `ThreadCachingPool` whenever an object is picked from the
    `ThreadLocal` we cannot add it to the `disposed` queue directly since the
    object will already be present in the `live` queue (or will be on release). Doing
    that means that the object will be present both in the  `live` and `disposed`
    queue and also means that on reallocation we can multiple copies of the same
    reference and can lead to that the `live` queue blows up in size.

driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/pool/ThreadCachingPool.java
driver/src/test/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/pool/ThreadCachingPoolTest.java
driver/src/test/java/org/neo4j/driver/v1/stress/ThreadCachingPoolStressTest.java

commit 207256aab1927d5bb2ef951bafc77729283f00cc
Author: Zhen Li <zhen.li@neotechnology.com>
Date:   Thu May 19 17:28:14 2016 +0200

    Tested the new start code on windows.
    Turns out that on windows, python scripts would fail to rename known_host file with the error `file occupied by other process.`
    This problem could be addressed by 1) closing each driver properly and/or 2) tiggering GC after each write op to known_host file.
    However we work around this problem in this PR by letting java driver code to delete the known_host file directly.

README.md

commit 01b974c669b2f0b126c3d63adff254af506a1fea
Author: Pontus Melke <pontusmelke@gmail.com>
Date:   Fri Apr 22 14:24:19 2016 +0200

    Fixed bitmasking error
    
    For large message sizes whenever the header was split up between packets there
    was a bitmasking error that calculated the chunksize wrong.

driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/connector/socket/BufferingChunkedInput.java
driver/src/test/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/connector/socket/BufferingChunkedInputTest.java

commit 05e3f59d0d30091930354539c7d85a413eeac7bb
Author: Jacob Hansson <jakewins@gmail.com>
Date:   Fri Apr 22 14:02:30 2016 +0200

    Resolve issue where pooled connections could leak if exception occurred
    during close.
    
    - close in PooledConnection calls reset and then returns the session to
      the pool. However, returning the session was not in a finally clause,
      so reset throwing an exception would leak the connection, eventually
      draining the pool from available sessions.

driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/pool/PooledConnection.java
driver/src/test/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/pool/PooledConnectionTest.java

commit 12dfe1a840da2e0ee2f4de449cf0e5e11cf36428
Merge: dbea6ffe 54610a41
Author: Pontus Melke <pontusmelke@gmail.com>
Date:   Thu Apr 21 10:27:36 2016 +0200

    Merge pull request #165 from jakewins/tls
    
    Resolve deadlock issue in TLSSocketChannel

commit 54610a418f7ccedd0194a69e7dee1107d2651088
Author: Jacob Hansson <jakewins@gmail.com>
Date:   Wed Apr 20 16:53:27 2016 +0200

    Resolve deadlock issue in TLSSocketChannel
    
    This introduces a comprehensive test suite for testing thousands of
    different buffer size, network frame size and message size combinations
    for the TLSSocketChannel.
    
    This test uncovered several issues, notably it found a blocking issue
    that is resolved in this commit as well, where the hand shake portion
    of the exchange would also read a bit "into" user data space, and that
    data would then get lost - subsequently, when the client layer asked for
    the amount of data it "expected" to be in place, it'd block indefinitely
    because of that lost data ensuring we'd never add up to the expected amount.
    
    Notably, this commit also removes four unit tests. These tests are covered
    by the more comprehensive test, and were rather mock and stub heavy, meaning
    it seemed preferrable to remove them than to refactor them to work with the
    changes to the implementation

driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/connector/socket/SocketClient.java
driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/connector/socket/TLSSocketChannel.java
driver/src/test/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/connector/socket/TLSSocketChannelTest.java
driver/src/test/java/org/neo4j/driver/v1/integration/LoadCSVIT.java
driver/src/test/java/org/neo4j/driver/v1/integration/TLSSocketChannelFragmentationIT.java
driver/src/test/java/org/neo4j/driver/v1/integration/TLSSocketChannelIT.java
driver/src/test/resources/keystore.jks

commit 0a542941f83eb86ddab83bb3a713b26e25246b8c
Author: Pontus Melke <pontusmelke@gmail.com>
Date:   Mon Mar 14 13:35:09 2016 +0100

    Properly handle collections in `Values`
    
    Previously we casted all collections to lists which broke with a
    `ClassCastException` whenever a non-list collection was provided
    as parameter. Also changed `value(List)` not to use random access
    since it will be slow for everything but `ArrayList`.

commit 94342d4dd8d07c8330410ea1f70dc1a0ed020af7
Author: Jacob Hansson <jakewins@gmail.com>
Date:   Fri Mar 11 12:48:36 2016 -0600

    Further API polish
    
    - asMap() and asList() now default to List<Object> and
      Map<String,Object>.
    - MapValue exposes asMap(), obviating properties()
    - Session.close() calls sync, ensuring all outstanding operations
      complete before the session is RESET when it enters the pool.
    - StatementRunner, Session, Transaction and StatementResult all
      have lengthy expansions describing the semantics of lazy results

driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/InternalEntity.java
driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/InternalRecord.java

commit a4d9b365f0761c8a9e8d58294f8933f907885d0e
Author: Jacob Hansson <jakewins@gmail.com>
Date:   Wed Mar 9 11:12:19 2016 -0600

    Final restructuring to help discoverability of API.
    
    Move interfaces that are not needed to get going into dedicated
    namespaces - summary, util and value - collapse unused interfaces,
    and finally remove Identity type.
    
    This creates a root API namespace which should be significantly easier
    to get started with, and through which users will discover the value
    types and, if they need them, the summary types.

commit 36f1693cb1e7ddb754fb90d6c7c4ff844fc93572
Author: Jacob Hansson <jakewins@gmail.com>
Date:   Wed Mar 9 10:25:00 2016 -0600

    Change ResultCursor to Iterator<Result>
    
    When we first designed the result cursor, the intention was to build a
    low-overhead API that didn't require allocating lots of objects to move
    through the result.
    
    In testing this with developers, there's been a fair bit of negative
    feedback and, more concerning - misunderstanding the model. Many
    developers are not used to the Cursor pattern, and don't untuitively
    imagine it as "moving a view" over the result. This leads to dissonance,
    which leads to frustration, which leads to suffering, which leads to the
    dark side.
    
    Tipping the scale is a series of experiments with escape analysis we
    did. It turns out that escape analysis is powerful enough to avoid heap
    allocation even for nested calls like:
    
        result.next().get("blah").get(0).asInt();
    
    The construct above can be allocated entirely on the stack, even if each
    method but the last returns a newly allocated object. This has been
    verified in experiments on HotSpot 25.74-b02, Java 8.
    
    Notably, the current implementation does not allow this, since Record
    is not allocated directly in the `next` method - but this is of no
    significance, because this was the case for the Cursor API as well. The
    point is that the API *allows* us to write heap-allocation-free impl in
    the future.
    
    This means that we can use an Iterator-based approach, which is MUCH
    more intuitive to end users. It also means we can do away with a
    significant amount of edge cases ("this method only works if the cursor
    is in so-and-so position") and a long slew of methods put in place to
    avoid allocation (eg. `single(<fieldName>)` and friends).
    
    Finally, it means there is no longer a distinction between 'retaining'
    an individual record and 'viewing' a record. A record is always an
    immutable copy, if you store it somewhere it works like any other
    object. If you don't, escape analysis will allow allocating it on the
    stack.

commit f835f53d74fb07fc65a342f5ce6ce37d5f83732e
Author: Jacob Hansson <jakewins@gmail.com>
Date:   Thu Mar 3 22:25:32 2016 -0600

    Throw exceptions on concurrent usage of connections.
    
    Sessions are not thread safe. However, we did not previously guard
    against concurrent usage, which leads to unpredictable behavior
    if an application accidentally uses a session from two places at
    the same time.
    
    This changes that unpredictable behavior to a more helpful and
    deterministic exception.

driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/connector/ConcurrencyGuardingConnection.java

commit 506829a838c31ce7f7f5b464debb16c060f6c0cd
Author: Jacob Hansson <jakewins@gmail.com>
Date:   Mon Feb 22 19:29:14 2016 -0600

    Cut back auth API to minimum needed to pass basic usage test
    
    - This keeps the same model - principal, credential, token - as
      originally proposed, but only exposes the concrete parts of the
      model as required to satisfy a minimal use case. This should be
      suitable to build upon as need arises for end users.

Date:   Mon Feb 15 11:55:03 2016 +0100

    Remove unused methods from Neo4jRunner

commit afbd70685c0c1ef5ede89f033030fb23dd9fdeec
Author: Jacob Hansson <jakewins@gmail.com>
Date:   Sat Feb 13 10:49:58 2016 -0600

    Remove unused methods from Neo4jRunner
    
    Add guard against running when another Neo4j instance is running.
    
    The Neo4jRunner contained a lot of functionality that was not
    used, with four separate code paths for starting Neo4j, which made
    it somewhat complex to reason about how to prevent starting Neo4j
    over an existing instance. This removes those unused code paths and
    consolidates API usage to one main start path.

Author: Jacob Hansson <jakewins@gmail.com>

    Fix broken test

driver/src/test/java/org/neo4j/driver/v1/TransactionDocIT.java

commit d62518d362c984597639062abfb1549a4663ccd7
Author: Jacob Hansson <jakewins@gmail.com>
Date:   Wed Feb 3 18:51:21 2016 -0600

    Remove test for Connection #finalize
    
    This hurts bad to do, and I'm open to any suggestion for how to
    do this test in a way that is deterministic.
    
    Whenever #finalize is called on a user-level Session object,
    we check that the session was properly closed. If it was not
    closed, we generate an error and close the session.
    
    The test for this would create a Session object with no references,
    and then run tens of thousands of iterations of System.gc(),
    testing for #close() being invoked. This seems to have worked
    deterministically on Java 8, but on Java 7 it is flaky.
    
    I don't think testing for Java 7 in a JUnit assumption is
    a good solution, and instead I'm opting for removing the test,
    with the argument that this has been manually verified to work,
    it is a best-effort piece of code that in production usage is
    allowed to fail (since we can never guarante the finalizer will
    invoke us).
    
    If we drop java 7 support, we could look at reverting this commit.

driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/InternalSession.java
driver/src/test/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/InternalSessionTest.java

commit 8f3f913fed14956922f5f477f2f9253ce2b67157

commit d782b4d182ccc7edf94e0f66ad85f172e7769a27
Merge: 6821fd7e 791295a3
Author: Zhen Li <zhen.li@neotechnology.com>
Date:   Mon Jan 11 09:47:05 2016 +0100

    Merge pull request #105 from zhenlineo/1.0-handle-server-tenimation-error
    
    Drop connection/session peacefully on protocol violation error

commit 791295a3508f61e945ee14e855a4b22e888ab3bf
Author: Zhen <zhen.li@neotechnology.com>
Date:   Tue Dec 22 17:05:05 2015 +0100

    Drop connection/session peacefully on protocol violation error
    
    Scenario:
    
    C->S: RUN (&*()&&*%&^%I,
          PULL_ALL,...                   // Client sends to server a RUN message that cannot be understood by the server (unable to dechunk or unpack) and a PULL_ALL
    
    S->C: Neo.ClientError.Request, RST   // Server sends back an error for RUN message and the wish to close this connection, without a reply to PULL_ALL
    
    This PR makes sure that the client should close the connection/session immediately if the connection would be broken afterwards without waiting for any reply for PULL_ALL.

README.md

commit e76f32f24646008a6b478fe1c9fd6ef22aca84a1
Author: Stefan Plantikow <stefan.plantikow@googlemail.com>
Date:   Thu Dec 3 00:30:38 2015 +0100

    Restructuring *Like interfaces
    
    o New *Accessor naming
    o ListAccessor, MapAccessor no longer imply CollectionAccessor
    o RecordAccessor no longer inherits CollectionAccessor (use keys().size() if you need that)
    o Result.position and skip now return longs
    o Add Record.asMapValue
    o Rename Map.Entry to Field
    o Add Map.field* methods for better naming on records
    o Introduce PropertyAccessor and Field
    o Better distinction between maps of unordered properties and records of ordered fields
    o Also fixes some places where we still failed to return Values.NULL
    o Removes CollectionAccessor

commit e96240dd4e896686b7367eefe1f29e3346380bfc
Author: Stefan Plantikow <stefan.plantikow@googlemail.com>
Date:   Sat Nov 21 02:34:48 2015 +0100

    Implement new results api
    
    Includes: Incorporate feedback from PR discussion around API refactoring
    
    o Also adds a bunch of new asFooArray extraction methods
    o Drop support for value( byte[] )
    o Removed lenient extraction (asBoolean(), asString() in favour of being explicit)
    o char[] arrays are now treated as Strings
    o Add containsKey() and entries() to MapLike

commit e06f3fc2ea11f4d72ddca4e4044c72431441c533
Author: Zhen <zhen.li@neotechnology.com>
Date:   Wed Aug 5 13:17:18 2015 +0200

    Full authentication added
    
    When constructing the driver, if TLS is enabled and a trusted certificate file is provided to Config, then only the TLS connection using the certificates in the file will be accepted.
    The certificates in the file should be encoded using Base64 encoding, and each of the certificate is bounded at the beginning by -----BEGIN CERTIFICATE-----, and bounded at the end by -----END CERTIFICATE-----.
    
    Code example:
    Using the following code to create a driver with TLS enabled and trusted certificates in file `cert`
        `Driver driver = GraphDatabase.driver( url, Config.build().withTLSEnabled( true ).withTrustedCertificate( cert ).toConfig() );`

driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/Config.java
driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/connector/socket/SSLSocketChannel.java
driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/connector/socket/SocketClient.java
driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/connector/socket/TrustOnFirstUseTrustManager.java
driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/util/CertificateTool.java
driver/src/test/java/org/neo4j/driver/integration/SSLSocketChannelIT.java
driver/src/test/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/connector/socket/SSLTestSocketChannel.java
driver/src/test/java/org/neo4j/driver/util/CertificateToolTest.java

commit ca3bd93f5753d8d15deac39d26834e81d6dd8ec0
Author: Zhen <zhen.li@neotechnology.com>
Date:   Thu Jul 23 17:45:13 2015 +0200

    TLS connections with the server
    
    Enabled the driver to establish TLS (handshake) and close TLS connections with the server
    Added tests about data transfer with TLS connections, especially the data whose size is bigger than the pre-defined app/net buffer
    Added the option to turn on TLS in config

commit 1652c7b9253d5fc81a07f74a3e99dabfd3c18f14
Author: Zhen <zhen.li@neotechnology.com>
Date:   Wed Jun 10 17:11:17 2015 +0200

    Renamed the top class for database connection management from Neo4j to Driver. All the functions to establish a session with a Neo4j instance are now in Driver.
    Introduced configuration in Driver for configure each connection pool created in Driver
    Refined logging system to avoid generating debugging strings when debug is not enabled

commit 3af0bee0430153164a34c6f037ce25f1c91ae684
Merge: 4edb6538 f18dbddc
Author: Jacob Hansson <jakewins@gmail.com>
Date:   Mon Jun 22 11:26:44 2015 -0500

    Merge pull request #30 from zhenlineo/keep-tx-open-after-client-error
    
    Roll back tx on client error

commit f18dbddc066ad17e805242d8163abedb6a7b914b
Author: Zhen <zhen.li@neotechnology.com>
Date:   Mon Jun 22 14:01:35 2015 +0200

    Roll back tx on client error
    This PR is a response to the PR for server https://github.com/neo4j/neo4j/pull/4771
    When a `client error` is returned from the server, the transaction will be left open and can be used again after the `FAILURE` has been acknowledged. This is mainly to support user-driven queries, where a database administrator may have built up a large transaction, and we do not want a simple spelling mistake to roll it all back.

driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/StandardTransaction.java
driver/src/test/java/org/neo4j/driver/integration/ErrorIT.java
driver/src/test/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/StandardTransactionTest.java

commit 06e50cb37fe311b8955aa62711ac4adf90f5b339
Merge: d67a9f9a dca19d84
Author: Jacob Hansson <jakewins@gmail.com>
Date:   Tue Jun 2 13:59:22 2015 -0500

    Merge pull request #20 from zhenlineo/one-buffer-chunkInput
    
    One buffer in ChunkedInput&Output

commit dca19d84142398ac64875d28c784e241cb6d9045
Author: Zhen <zhen.li@neotechnology.com>
Date:   Fri May 22 10:27:25 2015 +0200

    One buffer in ChunkedInput&Output
    Switched to channels in ChunkedInput&Output.
    For input, instead of newing a new buffer every time a new chunk comes, we now write received data into a size-fixed buffer. If the incoming data size is greater than the buffer size, then we first read the amount of buffer size data and read more when the data in the buffer is consumed and more free space is available in the buffer.

commit d67a9f9afe4ffdc5224646843a18d3226429d215
Merge: 339923f1 56a83012
Author: Zhen Li <zhen.li@neotechnology.com>
Date:   Fri May 29 12:17:40 2015 +0200

    Merge pull request #19 from zhenlineo/master
    
    Reserve space for chunk header in ChunkedOutput

commit 56a83012e713f16365890d92d3b07774ede8ce9b
Author: Zhen <zhen.li@neotechnology.com>
Date:   Thu May 28 19:39:19 2015 +0200

    Reserve space for chunk header in ChunkedOutput
    Fixed a bug where ChunkedOutput forgot to reserve space for chunk header. This bug arises if space left in current chunk is enough for data-to-write, but not header + data-to-write. The bug is fixed by ensuring space left is enough for header + data-to-write if data are to be written to a new chunk.

driver/src/main/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/connector/socket/ChunkedOutput.java
driver/src/test/java/org/neo4j/driver/internal/connector/socket/ChunkedOutputTest.java

commit a9fbcac68e6c4248cc748c67452f25d74b9987e7
Merge: d1565f60 0793c390
Author: Jacob Hansson <jakewins@gmail.com>
Date:   Mon May 18 09:32:20 2015 -0500

    Merge pull request #14 from zhenlineo/parameterIT-failure
    
    The client should always handle message ending '00 00'

commit 0793c390fdbae51131296e77af9cc7f0995d2ea0
Author: Zhen <zhen.li@neotechnology.com>
Date:   Mon May 18 14:42:24 2015 +0200

    The client should always handle message ending '00 00'
    When reading messages (ignoreMessage, failureMessage, etc.) from server, on message compelte, we should always expect `00 00` as the mark of ending. This PR makes sure `00 00` message is always handled before next client-server conversation starts.

    Merge pull request #3 from zhenlineo/master
    
    Get java driver to temporarily use kernel extension & neo4j server for ITs

commit fef6909d4e7e3e022b584f956778a06493307f88
Author: Zhen <zhen.li@neotechnology.com>
Date:   Fri Apr 24 17:31:52 2015 +0200

    Get java driver to temporarily use kernel extension & neo4j server for integration tests
    
    The kernel extension and neo4j server will be downloaded remotely using URLs.
    After the download, the neo4j server will be configured locally to enable ndp extension.
    The server is started and stopped using neo4j scripts.

driver/pom.xml
driver/src/test/java/org/neo4j/driver/stress/DriverStresser.java
